article:
Big Brother Brasil 23

Big Brother Brasil 23 was the twenty-third season of the Brazilian reality television series Big Brother Brasil, which premiered on January 17, 2023, on TV Globo. The show was produced by Endemol Shine Brasil and presented by Tiago Leifert.

The game

The game followed the same basic format as previous seasons, with a group of contestants, known as "housemates," living together in a specially designed house with cameras and microphones recording their every move. The housemates competed in various challenges and games to win prizes and avoid elimination.

### Final prize change throughout the season

In a twist, the final prize money was changed throughout the season. Initially, the winner would receive R$1.5 million. However, after a series of challenges, the prize money was increased to R$2.5 million.

### Super HoH

The Super HoH (Head of Household) was a special title given to the housemate who won a specific challenge. The Super HoH had the power to nominate two housemates for elimination and also won a special prize.

### Withdrawal Button

The Withdrawal Button was a new feature introduced this season. It allowed a housemate to withdraw from the game at any time and leave the house. However, if a housemate used the button, they would forfeit their chance to win the final prize.

### FeedBBB

FeedBBB was a social media platform where viewers could interact with the housemates and influence the game. Viewers could vote for their favorite housemates and also participate in challenges to win prizes.

## Selective Collection

Selective Collection was a twist where the housemates had to choose which items they wanted to keep in the house. The items they chose would be kept, while the rest would be discarded.

## Evicted's Message

Evicted's Message was a feature where an evicted housemate could leave a message for the remaining housemates. The message could be a warning, a piece of advice, or a farewell message.

## Glass House

The Glass House was a special area in the house where the housemates could see the outside world but could not interact with it. The Glass House was used for challenges and twists.

## Duos Twist

The Duos Twist was a new feature introduced this season. The housemates were paired up in duos, and they had to work together to win challenges and avoid elimination.

## Secret Room

The Secret Room was a hidden area in the house where a housemate could hide and avoid elimination. The Secret Room was revealed to the housemates at a later stage in the game.

## Higher Power

Higher Power was a special title given to a housemate who won a specific challenge. The Higher Power had the ability to influence the game and make decisions that would affect the other housemates.

## White Room

The White Room was a special area in the house where the housemates could relax and unwind. The White Room was also used for challenges and twists.

## Housemate Exchange

The Housemate Exchange was a twist where two housemates were exchanged with two new housemates from a different house.

## Repechage Twist

The Repechage Twist was a feature where an evicted housemate could return to the game. The evicted housemate would compete against another housemate, and the winner would return to the game.

## Vote to Save

Vote to Save was a feature where the viewers could vote to save a housemate from elimination. The housemate with the most votes would be saved.

## Power of Veto

Power of Veto was a special power given to a housemate who won a specific challenge. The Power of Veto allowed the housemate to veto a nomination.

## Joker Power

Joker Power was a special power given to a housemate who won a specific challenge. The Joker Power allowed the housemate to make a decision that would affect the game.

## Power of No

Power of No was a special power given to a housemate who won a specific challenge. The Power of No allowed the housemate to refuse a nomination.

## Big Phone

The Big Phone was a special feature where the housemates could receive calls from the outside world. The Big Phone was used for challenges and twists.

## The Counterattack

The Counterattack was a feature where the housemates could turn the tables on each other. The Counterattack was used to gain an advantage in the game.

Housemates

The housemates were a diverse group of people from different backgrounds and ages. They were selected through a rigorous selection process and were revealed to the public on the premiere night.

Future appearances

Several housemates from Big Brother Brasil 23 appeared on other TV shows and events after the season ended. Some of them pursued careers in entertainment, while others returned to their normal lives.

Voting history

The voting history was a record of the votes cast by the housemates and the viewers. The voting history was used to determine which housemates were eliminated and which ones stayed in the game.

## Notes

* The notes section contained additional information about the season, including the number of days the housemates spent in the house and the number of challenges they participated in.

## Have and Have-Nots

The Have and Have-Nots was a feature where the housemates were divided into two groups: the Haves and the Have-Nots. The Haves had access to luxuries and privileges, while the Have-Nots had limited resources and had to work harder to survive.

Ratings and reception

Big Brother Brasil 23 received high ratings and positive reviews from critics and viewers. The season was praised for its twists and challenges, as well as the diversity of the housemates.

## Brazilian ratings

The Brazilian ratings were a measure of the show's popularity in Brazil. Big Brother Brasil 23 was one of the most-watched shows in Brazil during its run.

Russian Invasion of Ukraine

The Russian invasion of Ukraine is an ongoing military conflict that began on February 24, 2022, when Russia launched a large-scale invasion of Ukraine. The conflict has resulted in significant human suffering, displacement, and economic costs for both Ukraine and Russia.

#Background

##Post-Soviet relations

Following the dissolution of the Soviet Union in 1991, Ukraine and Russia established diplomatic relations. However, the relationship between the two countries has been complex and often tense, with disputes over issues such as energy, trade, and security. Ukraine has pursued closer ties with the European Union and NATO, which has been met with resistance from Russia.

article:
2023–24 Indian Super League

The 2023–24 Indian Super League season is the 12th season of the Indian Super League, one of the top professional football leagues in India. The season started on 21 September 2023 and is expected to conclude on 25 March 2024.

# Changes from last season

The 2023–24 season sees several changes from the previous season. The number of teams participating in the league remains at 12. The league has introduced a new format for the playoffs, with the top two teams qualifying directly for the semi-finals, while the teams finishing between third and sixth will compete in the knockout stage.

# Teams

A total of 12 teams are participating in the 2023–24 Indian Super League season. The teams are:

* ATK Mohun Bagan
* Bengaluru FC
* Chennaiyin FC
* East Bengal FC
* FC Goa
* Hyderabad FC
* Jamshedpur FC
* Kerala Blasters FC
* Mumbai City FC
* NorthEast United FC
* Odisha FC
* Punjab FC

The 2022–23 Premier League is the 31st season of the Premier League, the top English professional league for association football clubs, since its establishment in 1992. The season started on 5 August 2022 and is scheduled to conclude on 28 May 2023.

The 2022–23 Premier League will feature 20 teams, including 17 teams from the previous season and three teams promoted from the Championship. The promoted teams are Fulham, Bournemouth, and Nottingham Forest, who replaced Burnley, Watford, and Norwich City.

The 2022–23 season saw several developments, including changes to the league's broadcasting rights, sponsorship deals, and stadium expansions. The Premier League announced a new broadcasting deal with Sky Sports, BT Sport, and Amazon Prime Video, worth £4.8 billion per year. India at the 2022 Commonwealth Games

The 2022 Commonwealth Games, officially known as the XXII Commonwealth Games, were held in Birmingham, England, from 28 July to 8 August 2022. India participated in the Games, sending a contingent of athletes to compete in various sports. This article provides an overview of India's participation in the 2022 Commonwealth Games.

# Withdrawal threat

In July 2022, the Indian Olympic Association (IOA) threatened to withdraw the Indian contingent from the Games due to the exclusion of shooting sports, which is a popular sport in India, from the 2022 Commonwealth Games program. However, the IOA later decided to participate in the Games, citing the interest of Indian athletes and the support of the government.

# Competitors

India sent a total of 215 athletes to compete in 15 sports at the 2022 Commonwealth Games. The contingent included 108 men and 107 women athletes. The sports in which India participated included athletics, badminton, boxing, cricket, cycling, gymnastics, hockey, judo, lawn bowls, para powerlifting, squash, swimming, table tennis, triathlon, and weightlifting.

article:
Instasamka

Instasamka is a Russian rapper, singer, and songwriter who has gained widespread recognition in the Russian music industry. Born and raised in Moscow, Instasamka rose to fame in the mid-2010s with her unique blend of hip-hop and pop music. With her distinctive vocal style and unapologetic lyrics, she has become one of the most popular and influential female rappers in Russia.

#Early life

Instasamka was born on May 6, 1998, in Moscow, Russia. Growing up in a creative family, she was exposed to music from an early age. Her parents, both music lovers, encouraged her to explore her musical talents, and she began writing her own songs as a teenager. Instasamka's early life was marked by a passion for music and a desire to express herself through creative means.

Instasamka's family moved frequently during her childhood, and she spent time in various parts of Moscow. This experience had a profound impact on her music, as she often draws inspiration from her surroundings and the people she meets. Despite her family's financial struggles, Instasamka's parents supported her musical ambitions, and she began performing at local talent shows and open mic nights.

#Career

Instasamka's music career began in 2015, when she started posting videos on social media platforms. Her early work was largely experimental, as she explored different styles and sounds. However, it wasn't long before she developed her signature style, which blends elements of hip-hop, pop, and electronic music.

In 2016, Instasamka released her debut single, "I'm Not Sorry," which quickly gained traction online. The song's success led to her signing with a major record label, and she released her debut album, "Trips," in 2017. The album was a commercial success, and Instasamka became a household name in Russia.

Since then, Instasamka has released several successful albums and singles, collaborating with prominent Russian artists and producers. Her music often explores themes of love, relationships, and self-empowerment, resonating with a wide audience. Instasamka's live performances are highly energetic and engaging, and she has toured extensively throughout Russia and Europe.

#Personal life

Instasamka is known for her outspoken and confident personality, often using her platform to speak out on social issues and advocate for women's rights. She has been open about her struggles with anxiety and depression, using her music as a means of self-expression and healing.

In her free time, Instasamka enjoys traveling and exploring new places. She is an avid reader and is passionate about literature and poetry. Instasamka is also a dedicated animal lover and has been involved in several charitable initiatives supporting animal welfare organizations.

#Discography

##Studio albums

* Trips (2017)
* Born to Flex (2018)
* Ostavaiu Seks (2020)

##Remix albums

* Trips: The Remixes (2018)
* Born to Flex: The Remixes (2019)

#Preferences

Instasamka's music preferences are diverse and eclectic, reflecting her experimental approach to songwriting. She has cited influences ranging from Russian folk music to American hip-hop and electronic dance music. Instasamka is also a fan of classic rock and pop music, often incorporating elements of these genres into her work.

In terms of specific artists, Instasamka has expressed admiration for Russian rappers such as Pharaoh and Boulevard Depo, as well as international acts like Kendrick Lamar and Billie Eilish. She is also a fan of electronic music producers like Skrillex and Flume, often collaborating with similar artists on her own projects.

2022 Welsh Open (snooker)

The 2022 Welsh Open was a professional snooker tournament that took place from February 28 to March 6, 2022, at the ICC Wales in Newport, Wales. It was the 31st edition of the Welsh Open and the 12th ranking event of the 2021-2022 snooker season.

#Format

The tournament was played with a 128-player main draw, featuring 112 professionals and 16 amateurs. The top 16 players in the world rankings received a first-round bye, while the remaining players competed in the qualifying rounds. The main draw was played as a knockout tournament, with each match played as the best of 7 frames.

##Prize fund

The total prize fund for the tournament was £405,000, with the winner receiving £70,000.

#Summary

The 2022 Welsh Open was a highly competitive tournament, featuring several upsets and comebacks throughout the week.

##Early rounds

The tournament began with the qualifying rounds, which saw several top players struggle to advance. World number 14, David Gilbert, lost to amateur player, Liam Davies, in the first round, while world number 22, Martin O'Donnell, was defeated by fellow professional, Ashley Carty.

##Last 16

The last 16 saw several high-profile matches, including a thrilling encounter between world number 1, Mark Selby, and world number 16, Ricky Walden. Selby eventually won 4-3, but Walden had chances to win the match. Another notable match saw world number 4, Ronnie O'Sullivan, defeat world number 13, Stuart Bingham, 4-2.

##Quarter-finals

The quarter-finals saw several close matches, including a 4-3 win for world number 2, Judd Trump, over world number 10, Kyren Wilson. Trump made several impressive comebacks throughout the match to advance to the semi-finals.

##Semi-finals

The semi-finals saw two high-quality matches, with world number 1, Mark Selby, facing world number 2, Judd Trump, and world number 4, Ronnie O'Sullivan, facing world number 7, John Higgins. Trump won a closely contested match 6-4, while O'Sullivan defeated Higgins 6-3.

##Final

The final saw world number 2, Judd Trump, face world number 4, Ronnie O'Sullivan. The match was a highly anticipated encounter between two of the sport's biggest stars. Trump dominated the early stages of the match, winning 3 of the first 4 frames. However, O'Sullivan fought back, winning 4 of the next 5 frames to take a 6-4 lead. Trump won the next frame, but O'Sullivan closed out the match, winning 9-5.

#Main draw

##Top half

The top half of the draw saw several upsets, including a first-round loss for world number 3, Neil Robertson. The standout performer in the top half was world number 2, Judd Trump, who advanced to the quarter-finals without dropping a frame.

Super Bowl LVII Halftime Show

The Super Bowl LVII halftime show took place on February 12, 2023, at State Farm Stadium in Glendale, Arizona, as part of Super Bowl LVII. The show was headlined by renowned American singer and songwriter, Rihanna, marking her first live performance in over five years. The event was a highly anticipated and widely watched spectacle, attracting a massive global audience.

# Background and overview

The National Football League (NFL) announced Rihanna as the headlining performer for the Super Bowl LVII halftime show in September 2022. The news generated significant excitement and attention, given Rihanna's immense popularity and her decision to take a hiatus from live performances since 2018. The halftime show was produced by Roc Nation and Jesse Collins Entertainment, in collaboration with the NFL.

Rihanna's performance was highly anticipated, with many fans and critics speculating about the set list, guest appearances, and overall production. The event was also seen as an opportunity for Rihanna to promote her upcoming projects and music releases.

The halftime show featured a medley of Rihanna's hit songs, including "Work," "Wild Thoughts," "Rude Boy," and "Umbrella." The performance included elaborate stage designs, pyrotechnics, and a massive team of dancers and crew members. Rihanna's vocals and stage presence were widely praised, with many considering the show to be a triumphant return to live performance.

# Reception

The Super Bowl LVII halftime show received widespread critical acclaim, with many praising Rihanna's performance, stage presence, and overall production. The show was also a massive commercial success, attracting a record-breaking audience and generating significant buzz on social media.

The Super Bowl LVII halftime show had a significant commercial impact, attracting a record-breaking audience and generating substantial buzz on social media. According to Nielsen Media Research, the show was watched by over 118.7 million viewers in the United States, making it one of the most-watched television events in U.S. history.

The show also had a significant impact on Rihanna's music sales and streaming activity. According to the Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA), Rihanna's music sales increased by over 500% in the week following the show, with several of her songs re-entering the Billboard Hot 100 chart.

article:
The Fabelmans

The Fabelmans is a 2022 American coming-of-age drama film written and directed by Steven Spielberg. The film is a semi-autobiographical account of Spielberg's own childhood and his early fascination with filmmaking. The movie follows the journey of Sammy Fabelman, a young boy who discovers his passion for filmmaking and learns to navigate the complexities of family, friendship, and growing up.

#Plot

The film is set in the 1950s and 1960s and follows the life of Sammy Fabelman, a young boy who grows up in a Jewish family in Arizona. Sammy's parents, Burt and Mitzi, are loving and supportive, but they are also struggling with their own marital issues. Sammy's father is an engineer who works for a computer company, while his mother is a homemaker who dreams of becoming a professional pianist.

Sammy's life changes when he discovers his passion for filmmaking. He begins making short films with his friends and family, using his father's camera and editing equipment. As he grows older, Sammy becomes more and more obsessed with filmmaking, often neglecting his schoolwork and relationships with his family and friends.

Meanwhile, Sammy's family is dealing with their own set of problems. His parents' marriage is falling apart, and his mother is struggling with depression. Sammy's father is also facing challenges at work, as the computer company is downsizing and he is at risk of losing his job.

Throughout the film, Sammy navigates these challenges and learns to balance his passion for filmmaking with his responsibilities to his family and friends. Along the way, he discovers the power of storytelling and the impact that it can have on people's lives.

#Production

##Development

The Fabelmans is a semi-autobiographical account of Steven Spielberg's own childhood and his early fascination with filmmaking. Spielberg has said that he has been wanting to make a film about his childhood for many years, but he was waiting for the right moment. In 2020, he finally felt ready to tell his story, and he began working on the script.

##Writing

Spielberg wrote the script for The Fabelmans with Tony Kushner, a longtime collaborator and friend. The two have worked together on several films, including Lincoln and West Side Story. Kushner has said that he was drawn to the project because of its personal nature and the opportunity to explore Spielberg's childhood.

##Pre-production

Pre-production on The Fabelmans began in 2021, with Spielberg and his team scouting locations and casting actors. The film was shot on location in Arizona and California, with additional scenes filmed in New York City.

##Casting

The cast of The Fabelmans includes Gabriel LaBelle as Sammy Fabelman, Michelle Williams as Mitzi Fabelman, and Paul Dano as Burt Fabelman. The film also features Seth Rogen, Julia Butters, and Judd Hirsch in supporting roles.

##Filming

Filming on The Fabelmans began in July 2021 and wrapped in October 2021. The film was shot using a combination of digital and film cameras, with Spielberg working closely with his cinematographer, Janusz Kaminski.

##Production design

The production design for The Fabelmans was led by Adam Stockhausen, who has worked with Spielberg on several films. The film's sets and costumes were designed to evoke the 1950s and 1960s, with a focus on period accuracy.

##Visual effects

The visual effects for The Fabelmans were led by Michael Kahn, who has worked with Spielberg on several films. The film's visual effects were used to enhance the film's period setting and to create the illusion of Sammy's films.

#Music

The score for The Fabelmans was composed by John Williams, who has worked with Spielberg on many films. The score features a mix of orchestral and choral music, with a focus on evoking the emotions and themes of the film.

#Themes and interpretations

The Fabelmans explores several themes, including the power of storytelling, the importance of family, and the challenges of growing up. The film also touches on issues of identity and belonging, as Sammy navigates his Jewish heritage and his passion for filmmaking.

#Release

##Theatrical

The Fabelmans was released in theaters on November 11, 2022, by Universal Pictures. The film received a limited release, with a wide release following on Thanksgiving weekend.

##Home media

The Fabelmans will be released on home media in 2023, with a Blu-ray and DVD release planned for the spring.

##Marketing

The marketing campaign for The Fabelmans began in the summer of 2022, with the release of a teaser trailer. The film's trailer was met with widespread critical acclaim, with many praising the film's nostalgic feel and its exploration of Spielberg's childhood.

#Reception

The Fabelmans opened at number one at the box office, with a weekend gross of $10 million. The film went on to gross over $50 million worldwide, making it a moderate box office success.

##Critical response

The Fabelmans received widespread critical acclaim, with many praising the film's nostalgic feel and its exploration of Spielberg's childhood. The film holds a 95% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, with many critics praising the film's performances, direction, and screenplay.

##Legacy

The Fabelmans is likely to be remembered as one of the standout films of 2022, with many praising its nostalgic feel and its exploration of Spielberg's childhood. The film's success is also likely to inspire a new generation of filmmakers, who will be drawn to its themes of creativity and perseverance.

##Accolades

The Fabelmans has received several awards and nominations, including several Academy Award nominations. The film's cast and crew have also received numerous awards and nominations, including several Golden Globe nominations.

article:
Barry Humphries
================

Barry Humphries AO CBE (1934-2023) was an Australian comedian, actor, satirist, artist, and author. He was best known for his on-stage and television alter egos, particularly his most famous character, Dame Edna Everage, a Melbourne housewife and "gigastar". Humphries' work has been widely acclaimed and has had a significant impact on popular culture.

Early life
------------

Barry Humphries was born on February 17, 1934, in Kew, Melbourne, Victoria, Australia. His father, Eric Humphries, was an architect, and his mother, Louisa Humphries, was a homemaker. Humphries was the second of four children, and his family was considered to be middle-class.

### Education

Humphries attended Melbourne Grammar School and later studied at the University of Melbourne, where he was a member of the Melbourne Theatre Company. He graduated with a Bachelor of Arts degree in 1956.

Career
--------

### Early career in Australia

Humphries began his career in the entertainment industry in the 1950s, working as a stand-up comedian and actor in Melbourne. He was a member of the Melbourne Theatre Company and appeared in several stage productions, including a production of "Hamlet" in 1955.

### London and the 1960s

In 1959, Humphries moved to London, where he became a key figure in the city's satirical and comedy scene. He was a regular performer at the famous Establishment Club and appeared on several British television shows, including "The Tonight Show" and "The Morecambe and Wise Show".

### 1970s

In the 1970s, Humphries' popularity continued to grow, and he became a household name in Australia and the United Kingdom. He appeared in several stage shows, including "Housewife Superstar!" and "Dame Edna Everage's Gala Performance".

### Film roles

Humphries has appeared in several films, including "Bedazzled" (1967), "The Bliss of Mrs. Blossom" (1968), and "The Great Gatsby" (1974). He also provided voice work for several animated films, including "The Muppet Movie" (1979) and "The Muppet Christmas Carol" (1992).

### One-man shows

Humphries has performed in several one-man shows throughout his career, including "Barry Humphries as Barry McKenzie" (1973) and "Back to My Roots and Other Suckers" (1990). He has also performed several farewell tours, including "The Last Night of the Poms" (1999) and "Eat Pray Laugh!" (2012).

### Television roles

Humphries has appeared on several television shows, including "The Dame Edna Experience" (1987-1989), "The Barry Humphries Show" (1976-1977), and "Dame Edna's Hollywood" (1991-1992). He has also made guest appearances on several popular shows, including "The Simpsons" and "Saturday Night Live".

### Success in the United States

In the 1990s, Humphries experienced significant success in the United States, particularly with his character Dame Edna Everage. He appeared on several American television shows, including "The Tonight Show with Johnny Carson" and "Late Night with David Letterman".

### Farewell tour

In 2012, Humphries embarked on a farewell tour, which included performances in Australia, the United Kingdom, and the United States. The tour was a critical and commercial success, and Humphries was praised for his energy and wit.

### Weimar Cabaret

In 2016, Humphries performed a series of shows at the Barbican Centre in London, which were inspired by the Weimar Republic's cabarets of the 1920s and 1930s. The shows were a critical success and featured a mix of music, comedy, and drama.

Characters
------------

### Dame Edna Everage

Dame Edna Everage is Humphries' most famous character, a Melbourne housewife and "gigastar". Dame Edna first appeared on stage in the 1950s and has since become a cultural icon in Australia and around the world. She is known for her wit, charm, and outrageous behavior.

### Sir Les Patterson

Sir Les Patterson is another of Humphries' famous characters, a boorish and lecherous Australian diplomat. Sir Les first appeared on stage in the 1970s and has since become a cultural icon in Australia.

### Sandy Stone

Sandy Stone is a character that Humphries created in the 1990s, a retired Australian accountant who is struggling to come to terms with the modern world. Sandy Stone has appeared in several stage shows and has been praised for his wit and pathos.

Personal life
--------------

### Views on transgenderism

In 2016, Humphries sparked controversy when he expressed his views on transgenderism, stating that he was "skeptical" of the idea of transgender people. He later apologized for his comments, stating that he had been "misinformed".

### Death

Barry Humphries passed away on April 22, 2023, at the age of 89.

Other work
------------

### Bibliography

Humphries has written several books, including "Bizarre" (1965), "The Barry Humphries Book of Innocent Austral Verse" (1968), and "My Life As Me" (2002).

### Filmography

Humphries has appeared in several films, including "Bedazzled" (1967), "The Bliss of Mrs. Blossom" (1968), and "The Great Gatsby" (1974).

### Discography

Humphries has released several albums, including "A Nice Cup of Tea and a Sit Down" (1972) and "Dame Edna's Greatest Hits" (1988).

### Biographical studies

Several biographical studies have been written about Humphries, including "Barry Humphries: The Authorized Biography" (2002) and "Dame Edna Everage: My Life Story" (2009).

### Fictional characters

Humphries has created several fictional characters throughout his career, including Dame Edna Everage, Sir Les Patterson, and Sandy Stone.

Awards and honours

Humphries has received several awards and honors throughout his career, including a BAFTA Award, a Tony Award, and an Order of Australia.

article:
RRR

RRR is a 2022 Indian Telugu-language period action drama film directed by S. S. Rajamouli and produced by D. V. V. Danayya of DVV Entertainments. The film stars N. T. Rama Rao Jr. and Ram Charan in the lead roles, with Alia Bhatt and Olivia Morris playing the female leads. The film is set in the 1920s and is a fictionalized account of the lives of two real-life Indian revolutionaries, Komaram Bheem and Alluri Sitarama Raju.

#Plot

The film is set in the 1920s and tells the story of two Indian revolutionaries, Komaram Bheem and Alluri Sitarama Raju, who fought against the British colonial rule in India. The film begins with the introduction of Komaram Bheem, a Gond tribal leader who lives in the forests of Adilabad. Bheem is a fierce warrior who is determined to protect his people from the British colonialists. On the other hand, Alluri Sitarama Raju is a police officer who is tasked with capturing Bheem.

As the story progresses, we see the two men develop a deep bond, despite being on opposite sides of the law. Bheem is impressed by Raju's bravery and sense of justice, while Raju is drawn to Bheem's conviction and determination. The two men join forces to fight against the British colonialists, who are exploiting and oppressing the Indian people.

The film's second half follows the two men as they launch a series of attacks against the British colonialists. The film's climax features an epic battle between the Indian revolutionaries and the British colonialists. The film ends with the defeat of the British colonialists and the emergence of Bheem and Raju as heroes of the Indian independence movement.

#Cast

* N. T. Rama Rao Jr. as Komaram Bheem
* Ram Charan as Alluri Sitarama Raju
* Alia Bhatt as Sita
* Olivia Morris as Jennifer
* Ajay Devgn as Venkata Rama Raju
* Ray Stevenson as Governor Scott Buxton
* Alison Doody as Lady Buxton
* Samuthirakani as Venkateswarulu
* Rajeev Kanakala as Venkateswarulu's son

#Production

##Development

RRR was first announced in 2018, with S. S. Rajamouli set to direct and D. V. V. Danayya set to produce. The film's script was written by Rajamouli and his father, K. V. Vijayendra Prasad. The film's story is a fictionalized account of the lives of two real-life Indian revolutionaries, Komaram Bheem and Alluri Sitarama Raju.

##Casting

N. T. Rama Rao Jr. and Ram Charan were cast in the lead roles of Komaram Bheem and Alluri Sitarama Raju, respectively. The two actors underwent rigorous training to prepare for their roles. Alia Bhatt and Olivia Morris were cast as the female leads.

##Design

The film's production design was handled by Sabu Cyril. The film's sets were built in Hyderabad and other locations in India. The film's costumes were designed by Srinivas M. Rao.

##Principal photography

Principal photography began in November 2018 and lasted for over two years. The film was shot in various locations in India, including Hyderabad, Rajahmundry, and Adilabad.

##Post-production

Post-production work on the film began in 2020. The film's editing was handled by A. Sreekar Prasad. The film's visual effects were handled by V. Srinivas Mohan.

#Themes and influences

RRR explores several themes, including patriotism, friendship, and the struggle for independence. The film is influenced by Indian history and mythology. The film's story is a fictionalized account of the lives of two real-life Indian revolutionaries, Komaram Bheem and Alluri Sitarama Raju.

#Music

The film's soundtrack was composed by M. M. Keeravani. The film's songs were written by Chandrabose, K. Shiva Dutta, and Ramajogayya Sastry. The film's score was composed by M. M. Keeravani and Kala Bhairava.

#Marketing

The film's marketing campaign was handled by D. V. V. Entertainments. The film's trailer was released in December 2021. The film's promotional posters were released in January 2022.

#Release

##Theatrical

RRR was released theatrically on March 25, 2022, in Telugu, Tamil, Hindi, Kannada, and Malayalam. The film was released in over 10,000 theaters worldwide.

##Screenings and statistics

RRR was screened at several film festivals, including the Berlin International Film Festival and the Cannes Film Festival. The film became the highest-grossing Indian film of 2022, grossing over ₹1,200 crore worldwide.

##Distribution

The film's distribution rights were acquired by D. V. V. Entertainments. The film was distributed by D. V. V. Entertainments in India and by several other distributors in other countries.

##Home media

The film's home media rights were acquired by D. V. V. Entertainments. The film was released on DVD and Blu-ray in May 2022.

#Critical reception

##India

RRR received widespread critical acclaim in India. The film's direction, acting, and music were praised by critics. The film holds a 100% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes.

##International

RRR also received critical acclaim internationally. The film's direction, acting, and music were praised by critics. The film holds a 90% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes.

#Reception by international filmmakers

RRR was praised by several international filmmakers, including James Cameron and Steven Spielberg. The film's direction and acting were praised by the two filmmakers.

#Box office

RRR was a commercial success, grossing over ₹1,200 crore worldwide. The film became the highest-grossing Indian film of 2022.

#Impact

RRR had a significant impact on Indian cinema. The film's success paved the way for other Indian films to be released globally.

#Accolades

RRR won several awards, including the National Film Award for Best Feature Film and the Filmfare Award for Best Film.

#Adaptations

There have been several adaptations of RRR, including a novel and a graphic novel.

#Future

There have been reports of a sequel to RRR, but nothing has been officially announced.

UAAP Season 85 Volleyball Tournaments

The University Athletic Association of the Philippines (UAAP) Season 85 volleyball tournaments are the volleyball events of UAAP's 2022-23 season. The tournaments will be held from October 2022 to May 2023. The eight member universities of the UAAP will compete in four divisions: men's, women's, boys', and girls'.

# Tournament format

The tournament format for the UAAP Season 85 volleyball tournaments will be a single round-robin elimination round followed by a stepladder semifinals and a best-of-three finals series.

# Teams

The eight member universities of the UAAP will compete in the tournaments. The teams are:

* Adamson University (Adamson Falcons)
* Ateneo de Manila University (Ateneo Blue Eagles)
* De La Salle University (De La Salle Green Archers)
* Far Eastern University (FEU Tamaraws)
* National University (NU Bulldogs)
* University of the East (UE Red Warriors)
* University of the Philippines (UP Fighting Maroons)
* University of Santo Tomas (UST Growling Tigers)

## Name changes

The University of Santo Tomas (UST) women's volleyball team will be known as the UST Golden Tigresses, while the UST men's volleyball team will be known as the UST Tiger Spikers.

## Coaching changes

The Adamson University (Adamson Falcons) men's volleyball team will be led by new head coach, Domingo Custodio, who replaced the previous head coach, Leonardo Toyco.

# Venues

The tournaments will be held at the following venues:

* Mall of Asia Arena (Pasay City)
* PhilSports Arena (Pasig City)
* San Andres Sports Complex (Malate, Manila)
* UST Quadricentennial Pavilion (Sampaloc, Manila)

# Squads

Each team will have a maximum of 14 players in their roster.

## Imports

The following teams have imports in their roster:

* Adamson University (Adamson Falcons) - two imports
* De La Salle University (De La Salle Green Archers) - one import

Leonardo Torres Quevedo

Leonardo Torres Quevedo was a Spanish engineer, mathematician, and inventor, best known for his innovative work in the fields of aeronautics, computer science, and telecommunications. Born on December 28, 1852, in Santa Cruz de Igüña, Cantabria, Spain, Quevedo's life was marked by a passion for science and technology, leading to numerous groundbreaking inventions and contributions to various fields.

# Early life and education

Quevedo was born into a family of modest means, with his father working as a primary school teacher. Despite the limited financial resources, Quevedo's parents encouraged his interest in mathematics and science from an early age. He attended the Colegio de San Mateo in Logroño, where he excelled in his studies, particularly in mathematics.

In 1870, Quevedo enrolled in the University of Madrid, where he studied civil engineering. However, due to financial constraints, he had to interrupt his studies and work as a draftsman in a Madrid-based engineering firm. Later, he resumed his studies at the University of Santander, graduating in 1876 with a degree in civil engineering.

# Career

Quevedo's professional career spanned multiple fields, with significant contributions to aeronautics, computer science, and telecommunications.

## Cableways

In the late 19th century, Quevedo became interested in cableways, designing and building several systems for transporting goods and people in mountainous regions. His innovative designs improved the efficiency and safety of these systems, and he was awarded several patents for his work.

## Analogue calculating machines

Quevedo's work on analogue calculating machines began in the 1890s, with the aim of creating devices that could perform complex mathematical calculations. His machines used a combination of mechanical and electrical components to perform arithmetic operations, and he demonstrated his inventions at various international exhibitions.

## Aerostatics

Quevedo's interest in aeronautics led him to work on aerostatic devices, including airships and gliders. He designed and built several airships, including the "Quevedo's Airship," which was exhibited at the 1904 World's Fair in St. Louis, Missouri.

## Radio control: the Telekino

In the early 1900s, Quevedo began experimenting with radio control systems, leading to the development of the Telekino. This device used radio waves to control a robot, which could perform various tasks, including moving around and picking up objects. The Telekino was demonstrated in 1903, marking one of the first public displays of radio control technology.

## Formal language

Quevedo's work on formal language began in the 1910s, with the aim of creating a universal language that could be used for international communication. He developed a formal language system, which he called "Lengua Universal," and published a book on the subject in 1911.

## Laboratory of Automation

In 1915, Quevedo established the Laboratory of Automation in Madrid, with the goal of promoting research and development in the field of automation. The laboratory became a hub for innovation, attracting scientists and engineers from around the world.

## Chess automaton: El Ajedrecista

Quevedo's fascination with chess led him to create a chess-playing automaton, which he called "El Ajedrecista." This device could play chess against human opponents, using a combination of mechanical and electrical components to make moves.

## Essays on Automatics

Quevedo published several essays on automatics, including "Essays on Automatics" (1911) and "The Automatics" (1915). These works provided an overview of his research and development in the field of automation.

### Analytical machines

Quevedo's work on analytical machines began in the 1920s, with the aim of creating devices that could perform complex mathematical calculations. His machines used a combination of mechanical and electrical components to perform arithmetic operations, and he demonstrated his inventions at various international exhibitions.

## Naval projects

Quevedo's work on naval projects began in the 1920s, with the aim of improving the efficiency and safety of naval vessels. He designed and developed several systems, including a device for detecting underwater mines.

## Other inventions and miscellaneous activities

Quevedo's other inventions and activities included:

### Esperantist

Quevedo was an Esperantist, advocating for the use of Esperanto as a universal language. He published several works on the subject and was a member of the Universal Esperanto Association.

### Spanish-American Technological Dictionary

Quevedo edited the Spanish-American Technological Dictionary, a comprehensive reference work that provided definitions and explanations of technical terms used in various fields.

# Distinctions

Quevedo received several distinctions for his work, including:

* The Grand Cross of the Order of Isabella the Catholic (1905)
* The Grand Cross of the Order of Charles III (1913)
* The Gold Medal of the Royal Academy of Sciences (1915)

# Personal life, religious beliefs, and death

Quevedo was married to Doña Elena Veyán, and they had five children together. He was a devout Catholic and was known for his piety and humility.

Quevedo died on December 18, 1936, in Madrid, Spain, at the age of 83.

# Legacy

Quevedo's legacy is marked by his numerous contributions to various fields, including aeronautics, computer science, and telecommunications. His innovative inventions and ideas paved the way for future generations of scientists and engineers.

# In fiction

Quevedo has been featured in several works of fiction, including novels and films. His life and work have inspired numerous authors and artists, who have sought to capture his spirit and genius.

Aryan Valley

The Aryan Valley, located in the Ladakh region of the Indian state of Jammu and Kashmir, is a scenic and culturally significant area that has garnered attention in recent years due to its unique geography, history, and cultural heritage. Nestled in the heart of the Himalayas, the Aryan Valley is a fertile and picturesque region that has been home to various communities, including the Brokpas, for centuries.

#Geography and economy

The Aryan Valley is situated in the eastern part of Ladakh, near the border with Tibet. The valley is surrounded by towering mountains, including the Karakoram range, and is drained by the Doda River. The region's geography is characterized by vast plains, rolling hills, and scenic valleys, making it an ideal location for agriculture and animal husbandry. The valley's economy is primarily based on subsistence farming, with crops such as barley, wheat, and potatoes being the mainstay of the local population. Animal husbandry is also a significant contributor to the local economy, with yak, sheep, and goats being the primary livestock.

The region's harsh climate and limited infrastructure make it challenging for the local population to access markets and other essential services. However, in recent years, the Indian government has initiated various development projects aimed at improving the region's infrastructure and promoting economic growth. These initiatives include the construction of roads, bridges, and other critical infrastructure, as well as programs aimed at promoting tourism and supporting local entrepreneurship.

#History

The Aryan Valley has a rich and complex history that spans thousands of years. The region has been home to various communities, including the Brokpas, who have a distinct culture and language that is unique to the region.

##Brokpas

The Brokpas are an indigenous community that has lived in the Aryan Valley for centuries. They are believed to be descended from the ancient Aryan people who migrated to the region from Central Asia. The Brokpas have a distinct culture and language that is unique to the region, and they have maintained their traditions and customs despite the influence of external factors.

The Brokpas are primarily farmers and herders, and they have developed a unique system of agriculture and animal husbandry that is adapted to the region's harsh climate. They are also skilled craftsmen, and they produce a range of traditional products, including textiles, metalwork, and woodcarvings.

##Aryan association and neologism

In recent years, the term "Aryan" has been associated with the region due to the presence of the Brokpas, who are believed to be descended from the ancient Aryan people. However, this association is a neologism, and it is not supported by historical or scientific evidence.

The term "Aryan" was first used by the ancient Greeks to describe the people of Central Asia, and it was later adopted by the Nazis to describe the supposed racial superiority of the German people. However, this usage is widely recognized as a misnomer, and it is not supported by scientific evidence.

In the context of the Aryan Valley, the term "Aryan" is used to describe the region's cultural and linguistic heritage, rather than any supposed racial or ethnic identity. The Brokpas are a unique and distinct community that has a rich cultural heritage, and they are an important part of the region's history and identity.

article:
Eiji Tsuburaya
================

Eiji Tsuburaya was a Japanese special effects director, cinematographer, and film director. He is best known for his work on the Godzilla franchise and the Ultraman series, and is considered one of the most influential special effects artists in Japanese cinema.

Biography
----------

### Childhood to War Years: 1901-1945

#### Childhood and Youth (1901-1919)

Eiji Tsuburaya was born on July 7, 1901, in Sukagawa, Fukushima Prefecture, Japan. He was the eldest of three children, and his family was of moderate means. Tsuburaya's early life was marked by a strong interest in science and technology, and he spent much of his childhood building and experimenting with machines.

#### Early Career and Marriage (1919-1934)

Tsuburaya began his career in the film industry in 1919, working as a camera assistant for the Nikkatsu film studio. Over the next several years, he worked his way up the ranks, becoming a cinematographer and eventually a special effects director. In 1926, Tsuburaya married a woman named Yoshiko, with whom he would have two children.

#### J.O. Studios, Directorial Works, and Toho (1934-1940)

In 1934, Tsuburaya joined J.O. Studios, where he worked on a number of films, including the 1935 film "Chushingura," which would later become a classic of Japanese cinema. During this period, Tsuburaya also began to experiment with special effects, developing techniques that would later become hallmarks of his style.

In 1937, Tsuburaya joined Toho Studios, where he would work on some of the most iconic films of his career. During this period, he also began to develop his skills as a director, working on a number of films, including the 1938 film "The Abe Clan."

#### War Years (1941-1945)

During World War II, Tsuburaya's career was put on hold, as he was drafted into the Japanese military. He served in the army for four years, during which time he was stationed in China and the Philippines.

### Occupation Years to Chushingura: 1946-1962

#### Early Postwar Work (1946-1954)

After the war, Tsuburaya returned to Toho Studios, where he resumed his work as a special effects director. During this period, he worked on a number of films, including the 1949 film "The Invisible Man Appears," which was one of the first Japanese films to feature extensive special effects.

#### International Recognition (1954-1959)

In 1954, Tsuburaya's career took a major turn, as he began to work on the Godzilla franchise. The first film, "Godzilla," was released in 1954 and became an international sensation, introducing Tsuburaya's special effects work to a global audience.

Over the next several years, Tsuburaya worked on a number of films in the Godzilla franchise, including "Godzilla Raids Again" (1955) and "King Kong vs. Godzilla" (1962). During this period, he also began to experiment with new special effects techniques, including the use of miniatures and matte painting.

#### From The Secret of the Telegian to Chushingura (1960-1962)

In 1960, Tsuburaya worked on the film "The Secret of the Telegian," which was a major departure from his earlier work. The film was a science fiction epic, featuring extensive special effects and a complex storyline.

Over the next several years, Tsuburaya worked on a number of films, including the 1962 film "Chushingura," which was a remake of the classic 1935 film. This film marked a major milestone in Tsuburaya's career, as it was his first major directorial effort.

### Birth of a Company to Last Years: 1963-1970

#### Birth of a Company and Career Expansion (1963-1964)

In 1963, Tsuburaya founded his own production company, Tsuburaya Productions. This marked a major turning point in his career, as he was now able to produce and direct his own films.

Over the next several years, Tsuburaya worked on a number of films and television shows, including the 1964 series "Ultra Q," which was one of the first Japanese science fiction television shows.

#### Japanese-American Coproductions and Ultra Q (1964-1965)

In 1964, Tsuburaya began to work on a number of Japanese-American coproductions, including the film "Ghidorah, the Three-Headed Monster." This film was a major success, and it helped to establish Tsuburaya as a major player in the global film industry.

During this period, Tsuburaya also worked on a number of episodes of the television series "Ultra Q," which was a major hit in Japan.

#### Ultraman and Beyond (1966-1967)

In 1966, Tsuburaya began to work on the television series "Ultraman," which was a major success and helped to establish Tsuburaya Productions as a major player in the Japanese television industry.

Over the next several years, Tsuburaya worked on a number of films and television shows, including the 1967 film "Yongary, Monster from the Deep."

#### Final Works, Last Years, and Death (1968-1970)

In 1968, Tsuburaya's health began to decline, and he was forced to slow down his work. Over the next several years, he worked on a number of films and television shows, including the 1969 series "Ultra Seven."

Eiji Tsuburaya died on January 25, 1970, at the age of 68. He left behind a legacy as one of the most influential special effects artists in Japanese cinema.

Filmmaking
----------

### Style, Themes, and Techniques

Tsuburaya's filmmaking style was characterized by a focus on special effects, which he used to create elaborate and imaginative sequences. He was also known for his use of miniatures, matte painting, and other techniques to create realistic and detailed environments.

Tsuburaya's films often featured themes of science fiction and fantasy, and he was particularly interested in exploring the relationship between humans and technology. He was also known for his use of humor and satire in his films.

### Relationship with Cast and Crew

Tsuburaya was known for his close relationships with his cast and crew, and he was particularly close to his longtime collaborator, director Ishirō Honda. ## Early years

The monastery was founded in the 12th century by Sviatopolk II Iziaslavich, the Grand Prince of Kiev, and was dedicated to the Archangel Michael. The monastery quickly became an important center of learning and culture, and its monks played a significant role in the development of Ukrainian literature and art.

article:
Embassy without a Government

An embassy without a government is a diplomatic mission that operates in the absence of a recognized government or when the government is not functioning effectively. This phenomenon has occurred in various countries throughout history, often as a result of revolution, civil war, or regime change. In this article, we will explore the concept of an embassy without a government and examine specific cases in Russia, Spain, Poland, and Afghanistan.

# History

## Russia (1917–1925)

The Russian Revolution of 1917 led to the overthrow of the Romanov dynasty and the establishment of the world's first socialist state. However, the subsequent Russian Civil War (1917-1922) and the eventual rise of the Soviet Union resulted in a period of diplomatic uncertainty.

### Diplomatic missions after 1917

Following the revolution, many countries, including the United States, the United Kingdom, and France, maintained diplomatic relations with the Russian Provisional Government. However, after the Bolsheviks seized power in October 1917, these governments faced a dilemma. While some countries, such as the United Kingdom, recognized the Soviet government, others, like the United States, refused to do so.

As a result, many diplomatic missions in Russia continued to operate, but without formal recognition from the host government. This led to a situation where embassies and consulates functioned as de facto missions, often with limited authority and no official status.

### Dissolution of the Soviet Union

The Soviet Union's dissolution in 1991 marked the end of the Cold War and led to a significant shift in international relations. However, the legacy of the Soviet era continued to influence diplomatic practices, particularly in countries with complex histories of government change.

## Spain (1939–1977)

The Spanish Civil War (1936-1939) resulted in the establishment of a fascist dictatorship under General Francisco Franco. The war's end marked the beginning of a period of diplomatic isolation for Spain, which lasted until Franco's death in 1975.

### Diplomatic missions after 1939

Following the civil war, many countries, including the United Kingdom and the United States, maintained diplomatic relations with the Spanish government. However, the fascist nature of the regime led to widespread international criticism, and many countries, such as France, broke off relations.

As a result, some diplomatic missions in Spain operated without formal recognition from the host government or with limited authority. This led to a situation where embassies and consulates functioned as de facto missions, often with limited influence and no official status.

## Poland (1939–1990)

The German and Soviet invasion of Poland in 1939 marked the beginning of World War II. The subsequent occupation and division of Poland led to a period of diplomatic uncertainty, which lasted until the fall of communism in 1989.

### Diplomatic missions after 1939

Following the invasion, many countries, including the United Kingdom and the United States, maintained diplomatic relations with the Polish government-in-exile. However, the Soviet-backed Polish People's Republic, established in 1945, was recognized by many countries, including the Soviet Union and its Eastern European allies.

As a result, some diplomatic missions in Poland operated without formal recognition from the host government or with limited authority. This led to a situation where embassies and consulates functioned as de facto missions, often with limited influence and no official status.

## Afghanistan (2021–present)

The Taliban's takeover of Afghanistan in August 2021 marked the end of the Islamic Republic of Afghanistan and the establishment of an Islamic Emirate. However, the new government has not been recognized by most countries, leading to a period of diplomatic uncertainty.

### Diplomatic missions after 2021

Following the Taliban's takeover, many countries, including the United States, the United Kingdom, and Canada, evacuated their diplomatic staff and suspended operations. However, some countries, such as China, Russia, and Pakistan, have maintained diplomatic relations with the new government.

As a result, some diplomatic missions in Afghanistan operate without formal recognition from the host government or with limited authority. This has led to a situation where embassies and consulates function as de facto missions, often with limited influence and no official status.

* Government in exile

article:
2022 Rajya Sabha elections

The 2022 Rajya Sabha elections were held to elect 57 members to the Rajya Sabha, the upper house of the Parliament of India, from 15 states. The elections were held on June 10, 2022, and the counting of votes took place on the same day. The elections were necessitated due to the retirement of 57 members from the Rajya Sabha, whose terms were ending on July 4, 2022.

List of elections by states

Elections were held in the following 15 states:

* Assam
* Himachal Pradesh
* Kerala
* Nagaland
* Tripura
* Punjab
* Andhra Pradesh
* Telangana
* Chhattisgarh
* Madhya Pradesh
* Tamil Nadu
* Karnataka
* Odisha
* Maharashtra
* Rajasthan
* Uttar Pradesh

Results

## Members retiring and elected

### Assam

Two members, Ranee Narah and Ripun Bora, retired from the Rajya Sabha on June 14, 2022. The election was held to fill the two vacant seats. Pabitra Margherita and Dhrubajyoti Borah were elected to the Rajya Sabha from Assam.

### Himachal Pradesh

One member, Anand Sharma, retired from the Rajya Sabha on April 2, 2022. The election was held to fill the vacant seat. Pratibha Singh was elected to the Rajya Sabha from Himachal Pradesh.

### Kerala

Three members, M.P. Veerendra Kumar, K.K. Ragesh, and Elamaram Kareem, retired from the Rajya Sabha on April 2, 2022. The election was held to fill the three vacant seats. Jebi Mather, P. Santhosh Kumar, and A.A. Rahim were elected to the Rajya Sabha from Kerala.

### Nagaland

One member, K.G. Kenye, retired from the Rajya Sabha on April 2, 2022. The election was held to fill the vacant seat. Phangnon Konyak was elected to the Rajya Sabha from Nagaland.

### Tripura

One member, Jharna Das Baidya, retired from the Rajya Sabha on April 2, 2022. The election was held to fill the vacant seat. Manik Saha was elected to the Rajya Sabha from Tripura.

### Punjab

Five members, Ambika Soni, Partap Singh Bajwa, Shwait Malik, Balwinder Singh Bhunder, and Naresh Gujral, retired from the Rajya Sabha on April 9, 2022. The election was held to fill the five vacant seats. Preneet Kaur, Raja Warring, Sandeep Pathak, Sanjeev Arora, and Vikramjit Singh Sahney were elected to the Rajya Sabha from Punjab.

### Andhra Pradesh

Four members, T. G. Venkatesh, V. Vijayasai Reddy, Suresh Prabhu, and S. R. Parthiban, retired from the Rajya Sabha on April 2, 2022. The election was held to fill the four vacant seats. Beeda Masthan Rao, Alla Ayodhya Rami Reddy, S. Niranjan Reddy, and V. Vijayasai Reddy were elected to the Rajya Sabha from Andhra Pradesh.

### Telangana

Seven members, D. Srinivas, V. Lakshmikantha Rao, C. M. Ramesh, T. Devender Goud, K. Keshava Rao, R.apolu Bhanu Prasad, and Joginipally Santosh Kumar, retired from the Rajya Sabha on April 2, 2022. The election was held to fill the seven vacant seats. K. R. Suresh Reddy, B. Lingaiah Yadav, Vaddiraju Ravichandra, D. Damodar Rao, K. Prabhakar Reddy, Bandi Parthasaradhi Reddy, and Y. Srinivas Reddy were elected to the Rajya Sabha from Telangana.

### Chhattisgarh

Two members, Chhaya Verma and Ramvichar Netam, retired from the Rajya Sabha on April 2, 2022. The election was held to fill the two vacant seats. Rajendra Tamta and Shambhu Singh were elected to the Rajya Sabha from Chhattisgarh.

### Madhya Pradesh

Three members, Kailash Soni, Satyanarayan Jatiya, and L. Murugan, retired from the Rajya Sabha on April 2, 2022. The election was held to fill the three vacant seats. Sumitra Valmiki, Kavita Patidar, and Dharmendra Pradhan were elected to the Rajya Sabha from Madhya Pradesh.

### Tamil Nadu

Six members, M. Thambidurai, K. R. Arjunan, R. Vaithilingam, A. Vijayakumar, S. R. Balasubramoniyan, and T. K. Rangarajan, retired from the Rajya Sabha on July 24, 2022. The election was held to fill the six vacant seats. M. M. Abdulla, K. R. N. Rajeshkumar, S. Kalyanasundaram, C. Ve. Shanmugam, S. R. Parthiban, and P. Wilson were elected to the Rajya Sabha from Tamil Nadu.

### Karnataka

Four members, D. Kupendra Reddy, B. K. Hariprasad, Rajeev Gowda, and K. C. Ramamurthy, retired from the Rajya Sabha on April 2, 2022. The election was held to fill the four vacant seats. J. C. Madhuswamy, Jaggesh, Nirmala Sitharaman, and Lehar Singh Siroya were elected to the Rajya Sabha from Karnataka.

### Odisha

Three members, Soumya Ranjan Patnaik, Sasmit Patra, and S. R. Parthiban, retired from the Rajya Sabha on April 2, 2022. The election was held to fill the three vacant seats. Mamata Mahanta, S. R. Parthiban, and Sujeet Kumar were elected to the Rajya Sabha from Odisha.

### Maharashtra

Seven members, Sanjay Raut, P. Chidambaram, Praful Patel, Sharad Pawar, Ajit Pawar, Vikas Mahatme, and Sanjay Kakade, retired from the Rajya Sabha on April 2, 2022. The election was held to fill the seven vacant seats. Sanjay Raut, Imran Pratapgarhi, Praful Patel, P. Chidambaram, Sambhaji Chhatrapati, Shrikant Eknath Shinde, and Dhananjay Bhimrao Mahadik were elected to the Rajya Sabha from Maharashtra.

### Rajasthan

Three members, Bhupender Yadav, Harshvardhan Singh Dungarpur, and Ram Kumar Verma, retired from the Rajya Sabha on April 2, 2022. The election was held to fill the three vacant seats. Ghanshyam Tiwari, Kirodi Lal Meena, and Rajendra Gehlot were elected to the Rajya Sabha from Rajasthan.

### Uttar Pradesh

Eleven members, Sukhram Singh Yadav, Ram Gopal Yadav, Javed Ali Khan, Chandrapal Singh Yadav, Ravi Prakash Verma, Reoti Raman Singh, Arun Singh, Vijaypal Singh Tomar, Hardeep Singh Puri, G. V. L. Narasimha Rao, and Ashok Bajpai, retired from the Rajya Sabha on April 2, 2022. The election was held to fill the eleven vacant seats. Ram Gopal Yadav, Javed Ali Khan, Chandrapal Singh Yadav, Ravi Prakash Verma, Reoti Raman Singh, Arun Singh, Vijaypal Singh Tomar, Hardeep Singh Puri, G. V. L. Narasimha Rao, Ashok Bajpai, and Darshan Singh Yadav were elected to the Rajya Sabha from Uttar Pradesh.

### Uttarakhand

One member, Anil Baluni, retired from the Rajya Sabha on April 2, 2022. The election was held to fill the vacant seat. Kalpana Saini was elected to the Rajya Sabha from Uttarakhand.

### Bihar

Five members, R. K. Sinha, G. C. Chandrasekhar, Ramchandra Prasad Singh, M. P. Vijay, and S. S. Ahluwalia, retired from the Rajya Sabha on April 2, 2022. The election was held to fill the five vacant seats. Satish Chandra Dubey, Shama Naseem, Manoj Jha, Faiyaz Ahmad, and Dhrub Narayan Mahto were elected to the Rajya Sabha from Bihar.

### Jharkhand

Two members, Dhiraj Prasad Sahu and Sameer Oraon, retired from the Rajya Sabha on April 2, 2022. The election was held to fill the two vacant seats. Aditya Sahu and Mahua Maji were elected to the Rajya Sabha from Jharkhand.

### Haryana

Two members, D. P. Vats and Ram Chander Bainda, retired from the Rajya Sabha on April 2, 2022. The election was held to fill the two vacant seats. Brijendra Singh and Krishna Lal Panwar were elected to the Rajya Sabha from Haryana.

By-elections

### Bihar

A by-election was held on December 14, 2022, to fill the vacant seat caused by the resignation of R. K. Sinha from the Rajya Sabha. Satish Chandra Dubey was elected to the Rajya Sabha from Bihar.

### Telangana

A by-election was held on December 14, 2022, to fill the vacant seat caused by the resignation of B. Lingaiah Yadav from the Rajya Sabha. Vaddiraju Ravichandra was elected to the Rajya Sabha from Telangana.

### Odisha

A by-election was held on December 14, 2022, to fill the vacant seat caused by the resignation of Sasmit Patra from the Rajya Sabha. Mamata Mahanta was elected to the Rajya Sabha from Odisha.

### Tripura

A by-election was held on December 14, 2022, to fill the vacant seat caused by the resignation of Manik Saha from the Rajya Sabha. Biplab Kumar Deb was elected to the Rajya Sabha from Tripura.

Nominations

### Nominated members

A total of 12 nominated members were elected to the Rajya Sabha. The nominated members include:

* Sonal Mansingh
* Raghunath Mohapatra
* Ram Shakal
* Rakesh Sinha
* Sonal Mehta
* Leela Samson
* Subhash Chandra
* Mary Kom
* Sambhaji Chhatrapati
* Dhirubhai Gajera
* Arjun Munda
* Swapan Dasgupta

article:
2024 AFC U-23 Asian Cup qualification

The 2024 AFC U-23 Asian Cup qualification will be a men's under-23 football competition to determine the participating teams of the 2024 AFC U-23 Asian Cup. A total of 16 teams will qualify to play in the final tournament, including Uzbekistan who qualified automatically as hosts.

Format changes

The format of the qualification has been changed from the previous edition. The 44 teams will be divided into 11 groups of four teams, with the teams playing each other once in a single round-robin format. The 11 group winners and the four best runners-up will qualify for the final tournament.

Draw

The draw for the qualification was held on 2 June 2023 at the AFC House in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.

### Draw result

The teams were divided into four pots based on their performance in the 2022 AFC U-23 Asian Cup and the 2018 AFC U-23 Asian Cup. The teams were then drawn into 11 groups of four teams each.

Format

The qualification will be held from 6 to 12 September 2023. Each team will play three matches in a single round-robin format.

### Tiebreakers

If two or more teams are equal on points on completion of the group matches, the following tiebreakers will be applied:

* Goal difference in all group matches
* Greater number of goals scored in all group matches
* Greater number of points obtained in the group matches between the teams concerned
* Drawing of lots

Groups

The teams are divided into 11 groups of four teams each.

### Group A

* China PR
* Malaysia
* Singapore
* Philippines

### Group B

* Japan
* Vietnam
* Indonesia
* Timor-Leste

### Group C

* South Korea
* Thailand
* Laos
* Brunei

* Iran
* India
* Kyrgyzstan

### Group E

* Bahrain
* Turkmenistan

### Group F

* Tajikistan
* Nepal

* Maldives

### Group I

* Myanmar
* Cambodia
* Macau
* Mongolia

### Group J

* Palestine
* Syria
* Lebanon
* Guam

### Group K

* Kuwait
* Afghanistan
* Bhutan
* Northern Mariana Islands

Ranking of runners-up

The four best runners-up will qualify for the final tournament. The ranking of the runners-up will be determined by the following criteria:

* Points obtained in the group matches
* Goal difference in all group matches
* Greater number of goals scored in all group matches
* Drawing of lots

Goalscorers

The top scorers in the qualification will be awarded the AFC U-23 Asian Cup qualification Golden Boot award.

Qualified teams

The following teams will qualify for the 2024 AFC U-23 Asian Cup:

*  Uzbekistan (hosts)
* The 11 group winners
* The four best runners-up

article:
2023 FIFA U-20 World Cup

The 2023 FIFA U-20 World Cup is the 23rd edition of the FIFA U-20 World Cup, the biennial international youth football championship contested by the under-20 national teams of the member associations of FIFA. The tournament is scheduled to take place in Argentina from 20 May to 11 June 2023.

# Host selection

The bidding process for the 2023 FIFA U-20 World Cup was launched by FIFA in June 2019. Indonesia was initially announced as the host country on 24 October 2019. However, due to concerns over the country's infrastructure and the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic, FIFA announced in March 2023 that Argentina would replace Indonesia as the host country.

# Qualified teams

A total of 24 teams qualified for the 2023 FIFA U-20 World Cup. The qualified teams are:

* Argentina (hosts)
* Australia
* Brazil
* Colombia
* Dominican Republic
* Ecuador
* England
* France
* Gambia

* Honduras
* Iraq

* Slovakia
* South Korea
* United States
* Uruguay

# Venues

The 2023 FIFA U-20 World Cup is scheduled to take place in six stadiums across Argentina:

* Estadio Malvinas Argentinas in Mendoza
* Estadio San Juan del Bicentenario in San Juan
* Estadio La Ciudadela in San Miguel de Tucumán
* Estadio Provincial Juan Gilberto Funes in La Punta
* Estadio Único in San Nicolás de los Arroyos
* Estadio Julio Humberto Grondona in Sarandí

# Draw

The draw for the 2023 FIFA U-20 World Cup took place on 21 April 2023 in Zurich, Switzerland. The 24 teams were drawn into six groups of four teams each. The teams were seeded based on their performance in the previous two editions of the tournament.

# Match officials

A total of 17 referees and 30 assistant referees were appointed by FIFA for the 2023 FIFA U-20 World Cup. The match officials are:

* Referees:
	+ Mohamed Marouf (Egypt)

# Knockout stage

The knockout stage features the top two teams from each group, as well as the four best third-placed teams. The teams compete in a single-elimination tournament, with the winners advancing to the next round and the losers being eliminated.

## Bracket

* Quarter-finals:
	+ Winner of Group A vs. Winner of Group B
	+ Winner of Group C vs. Winner of Group D
	+ Winner of Group E vs. Winner of Group F
	+ Best third-placed team vs. Winner of Group A
* Semi-finals:
	+ Winner of Quarter-final 1 vs. Winner of Quarter-final 3
	+ Winner of Quarter-final 2 vs. Winner of Quarter-final 4
* Final:
	+ Winner of Semi-final 1 vs. Winner of Semi-final 2

* Match 1: Winner of Group A vs. Third-placed team from Group C/D/E

## Quarter-finals

* Match 9: Winner of Match 1 vs. Winner of Match 3
* Match 10: Winner of Match 2 vs. Winner of Match 5
* Match 11: Winner of Match 4 vs. Winner of Match 6
* Match 12: Winner of Match 7 vs. Winner of Match 8

## Semi-finals

* Match 13: Winner of Match 9 vs. Winner of Match 11
* Match 14: Winner of Match 10 vs. Winner of Match 12

## Third place play-off

* Match 15: Loser of Match 13 vs. Loser of Match 14

## Final

* Match 16: Winner of Match 13 vs. Winner of Match 14

article:
FTX
================

FTX was a cryptocurrency derivatives exchange that was founded in 2019 by Sam Bankman-Fried and Gary Wang. The company was headquartered in the Bahamas and quickly gained popularity as a platform for trading cryptocurrency derivatives, including options, futures, and perpetual swaps. FTX also operated a separate entity, FTX.US, which catered to the US market.

History
-------

FTX was founded in April 2019 by Sam Bankman-Fried, a well-known trader and entrepreneur in the cryptocurrency space. Bankman-Fried had previously founded Alameda Research, a quantitative trading firm that specialized in cryptocurrency trading. FTX was initially incubated within Alameda Research before spinning off as a separate entity.

In 2020, FTX raised $8 million in funding from investors, including Binance, a prominent cryptocurrency exchange. This investment helped FTX expand its operations and improve its infrastructure. In 2021, FTX raised an additional $900 million in funding, valuing the company at $18 billion.

FTX quickly gained popularity as a platform for trading cryptocurrency derivatives, known for its innovative products and user-friendly interface. The company also became known for its high-profile sponsorships and partnerships, including a deal with the Miami Heat to rename their arena to FTX Arena.

November 2022 Crisis and Bankruptcy
-----------------------------------

### Background: FTX and Alameda, Binance, and CoinDesk report

In the months leading up to the crisis, FTX had faced increasing scrutiny over its business practices and relationships with other companies. In November 2022, a report by CoinDesk revealed that Alameda Research, the trading firm founded by Sam Bankman-Fried, held a significant portion of its balance sheet in FTX's native token, FTT.

This revelation raised concerns about the close relationship between FTX and Alameda Research, as well as the potential risks to FTX's balance sheet. Binance, a major cryptocurrency exchange and investor in FTX, also began to express concerns about FTX's financial health.

### Crisis begins: Binance FTT sale, sell-off, and withdrawn rescue bid

On November 6, 2022, Binance announced that it would be selling its entire stake in FTT, citing concerns about FTX's financial health. This announcement triggered a sharp sell-off in FTT, as well as a broader decline in cryptocurrency markets.

As FTX's financial situation continued to deteriorate, Binance announced that it would be acquiring FTX in a deal that would have valued the company at $1. In a shocking turn of events, Binance withdrew its rescue bid just hours later, citing concerns about FTX's financial health and regulatory issues.

### Bankruptcy and unauthorized transactions

On November 11, 2022, FTX filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in the US, citing assets of $10 billion to $50 billion and liabilities of $10 billion to $50 billion. Sam Bankman-Fried also resigned as CEO of FTX.

In the days following the bankruptcy filing, it was revealed that FTX had suffered from unauthorized transactions, with hackers stealing hundreds of millions of dollars in cryptocurrency from FTX's wallets.

### Widening impact and contagion fears

The collapse of FTX sent shockwaves throughout the cryptocurrency industry, with many companies and investors exposed to FTX's financial troubles. Several prominent cryptocurrency companies, including BlockFi and Genesis, announced that they would be halting withdrawals or filing for bankruptcy.

Fears of contagion also spread to traditional financial markets, with many investors expressing concerns about the potential risks to the broader financial system.

### Responses and effects

#### Effects on investors

The collapse of FTX had a devastating impact on investors, many of whom lost millions of dollars in the collapse. Several high-profile investors, including Sequoia Capital and SoftBank, announced that they would be writing down their investments in FTX.

#### Effects on other cryptocurrency firms and cryptocurrency markets

The collapse of FTX also had a significant impact on other cryptocurrency firms and markets. Several prominent cryptocurrency exchanges and companies announced that they would be halting withdrawals or filing for bankruptcy.

Cryptocurrency markets also suffered a sharp decline, with many major cryptocurrencies losing 10-20% of their value in the days following the collapse of FTX.

#### Responses and commentary

Regulators and lawmakers around the world expressed concern about the collapse of FTX, with many calling for increased regulation of the cryptocurrency industry.

Several prominent figures in the cryptocurrency industry also weighed in on the collapse of FTX, with many expressing disappointment and frustration at the lack of transparency and accountability in the industry.

Legal Process
-------------

The collapse of FTX triggered a number of legal proceedings, including bankruptcy proceedings and regulatory investigations.

In the US, the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) announced that they would be investigating FTX and its affiliates.

Sponsorships
------------

FTX was known for its high-profile sponsorships and partnerships, including a deal with the Miami Heat to rename their arena to FTX Arena.

In the wake of the collapse of FTX, several prominent sports teams and organizations announced that they would be ending their partnerships with FTX.
