2022-23 European Windstorm Season

The 2022-23 European windstorm season was the period in which windstorms that affected Europe during the winter of 2022 and 2023. The season began on September 1, 2022, and ended on August 31, 2023. This article provides an overview of the background, naming conventions, season summary, storms, and effects of the season.

# Background and Naming

## Definitions and Naming Conventions

A European windstorm is defined as a storm that affects Europe and has wind gusts of at least 119 km/h (74 mph). The storms are named by various meteorological organizations across Europe, including the UK Met Office, the Irish Meteorological Service, and the Royal Netherlands Meteorological Institute, among others. The naming conventions vary across different regions, with some countries using their own naming lists while others use a shared list.

## Western Group (United Kingdom, Ireland and the Netherlands)

The Western Group, which includes the UK, Ireland, and the Netherlands, uses a shared naming list. The list is compiled by the UK Met Office, the Irish Meteorological Service, and the Royal Netherlands Meteorological Institute. The names are chosen from a list of male and female names that are alternating in alphabetical order.

## South-western Group (France, Spain, Portugal, Belgium and Luxembourg)

The South-western Group, which includes France, Spain, Portugal, Belgium, and Luxembourg, uses a shared naming list. The list is compiled by the French national meteorological service, Météo-France, and the Spanish national meteorological agency, Agencia Estatal de Meteorología (AEMET).

## Southeastern Mediterranean Group (Greece, Israel and Cyprus)

The Southeastern Mediterranean Group, which includes Greece, Israel, and Cyprus, uses a shared naming list. The list is compiled by the Greek national meteorological service, the Israel Meteorological Service, and the Cyprus Meteorological Service.

## Central Mediterranean Group (Italy, Slovenia, Croatia, Bosnia & Herzegovina, Montenegro, North Macedonia and Malta)

The Central Mediterranean Group, which includes Italy, Slovenia, Croatia, Bosnia & Herzegovina, Montenegro, North Macedonia, and Malta, uses a shared naming list. The list is compiled by the Italian national meteorological service, the Slovenian Environment Agency, and the Croatian Meteorological and Hydrological Service, among others.

## Northern Group (Denmark, Norway and Sweden)

The Northern Group, which includes Denmark, Norway, and Sweden, uses a shared naming list. The list is compiled by the Danish Meteorological Institute, the Norwegian Meteorological Institute, and the Swedish Meteorological and Hydrological Institute.

## Central & Southern Group (Germany, Switzerland, Liechtenstein and Austria)

The Central & Southern Group, which includes Germany, Switzerland, Liechtenstein, and Austria, uses a shared naming list. The list is compiled by the German national meteorological service, the Swiss Federal Office of Meteorology and Climatology, and the Austrian national meteorological service, among others.

## Ex-Atlantic Hurricane

Ex-Atlantic hurricanes that affect Europe are not included in the naming lists of the various meteorological organizations. Instead, they retain their original name assigned by the National Hurricane Center (NHC).

# Season Summary

2022–23 South-West Indian Ocean cyclone season

The 2022–23 South-West Indian Ocean cyclone season is the current cyclone season in the South-West Indian Ocean, which officially started on July 1, 2022, and will end on June 30, 2023. The season has been quite active, with several tropical cyclones forming in the region.

#Seasonal forecasts

Several national meteorological agencies and scientific institutions forecast the number of tropical cyclones that will form in the South-West Indian Ocean during the season. The forecasts are based on various climate models and statistical analysis of past seasons. The agencies that provide forecasts for this region include the Mauritius Meteorological Service, the Réunion Meteorological Service, and the South African Weather Service.

In July 2022, the Mauritius Meteorological Service forecast that the season would be near-normal, with 8-10 named storms forming. The Réunion Meteorological Service also forecast a near-normal season, with 9-11 named storms expected. The South African Weather Service forecast a slightly above-average season, with 10-12 named storms forming.

#Seasonal summary

As of March 2023, the season has seen 11 named storms form, making it an above-average season. The most intense storm of the season so far has been Very Intense Tropical Cyclone Freddy, which reached peak winds of 220 km/h (140 mph). The season has also seen several moderate tropical storms, including Ashley and Balita.

The season has been quite active in terms of the number of storms that have formed, but the intensity of the storms has been relatively low compared to previous seasons. The reason for this is the presence of a moderate El Niño event in the Pacific Ocean, which has led to increased wind shear in the South-West Indian Ocean.

#Systems

##Moderate Tropical Storm Ashley

Moderate Tropical Storm Ashley was the first named storm of the season. It formed on September 26, 2022, and dissipated on October 1, 2022. The storm peaked at winds of 110 km/h (70 mph) and made landfall in Mozambique.

##Moderate Tropical Storm Balita

Moderate Tropical Storm Balita was the second named storm of the season. It formed on October 15, 2022, and dissipated on October 22, 2022. The storm peaked at winds of 105 km/h (65 mph) and remained at sea.

##Tropical Depression 03

Tropical Depression 03 was a short-lived tropical depression that formed on November 1, 2022, and dissipated on November 2, 2022. The storm did not strengthen into a named storm.

##Very Intense Tropical Cyclone Darian

Very Intense Tropical Cyclone Darian was the third named storm of the season. It formed on November 20, 2022, and dissipated on December 1, 2022. The storm peaked at winds of 210 km/h (130 mph) and remained at sea.

##Tropical Cyclone Cheneso

Tropical Cyclone Cheneso was the fourth named storm of the season. It formed on January 18, 2023, and dissipated on January 28, 2023. The storm peaked at winds of 150 km/h (90 mph) and made landfall in Madagascar.

##Tropical Cyclone Dingani

Tropical Cyclone Dingani was the fifth named storm of the season. It formed on February 9, 2023, and dissipated on February 16, 2023. The storm peaked at winds of 120 km/h (75 mph) and remained at sea.

##Very Intense Tropical Cyclone Freddy

Very Intense Tropical Cyclone Freddy was the sixth named storm of the season. It formed on February 17, 2023, and is currently active. The storm has peaked at winds of 220 km/h (140 mph) and is expected to make landfall in Mozambique.

##Tropical Cyclone Enala

Tropical Cyclone Enala was the seventh named storm of the season. It formed on March 1, 2023, and dissipated on March 8, 2023. The storm peaked at winds of 100 km/h (65 mph) and remained at sea.

##Moderate Tropical Storm 09

Moderate Tropical Storm 09 was the eighth named storm of the season. It formed on March 15, 2023, and dissipated on March 22, 2023. The storm peaked at winds of 110 km/h (70 mph) and remained at sea.

##Intense Tropical Cyclone Fabien

Intense Tropical Cyclone Fabien was the ninth named storm of the season. It formed on March 20, 2023, and is currently active. The storm has peaked at winds of 180 km/h (115 mph) and is expected to remain at sea.

#Storm names

The storm names used for this season are taken from a list of names that was agreed upon by the World Meteorological Organization (WMO). The list of names is used in a cyclical manner, with the names of storms that caused significant damage or loss of life being retired.

#Season effects

The 2022–23 South-West Indian Ocean cyclone season has had significant effects on the region. The storms have caused widespread damage and disruption, particularly in Madagascar and Mozambique. The storms have also led to the loss of life, with several people reported dead or missing.

The season has also had significant economic impacts, particularly in the agricultural and fishing sectors. The storms have damaged crops and fishing infrastructure, leading to significant losses for farmers and fishermen.

article:
Ronald Wilson Reagan was the 40th President of the United States, serving from 1981 to 1989. A member of the Republican Party, he is known for his conservative policies and his role in ending the Cold War. Reagan's presidency is often credited with helping to end the Cold War and is often regarded as one of the most influential presidencies of the 20th century.

# Early life

Ronald Reagan was born on February 6, 1911, in a small apartment above a bank in Tampico, Illinois, to John Edward Reagan and Nelle Clyde Wilson Reagan. He was the younger of two sons. Reagan's father was of Irish Catholic descent, while his mother was of Scottish and English ancestry. The family moved to various towns in Illinois, including Galesburg, Monmouth, and Dixon, before settling in Dixon in 1920.

Reagan attended high school in Dixon, where he developed an interest in acting and sports. He was an average student, but he excelled in sports, particularly football, and was a member of the school's debate team. After graduating from high school in 1928, Reagan attended Eureka College, a small liberal arts college in Eureka, Illinois, where he studied economics and sociology. He graduated from Eureka College in 1932.

# Entertainment career

## Radio and film

After graduating from college, Reagan moved to Iowa, where he worked as a radio announcer for several years. In 1937, he moved to Los Angeles, California, where he began working as an actor in films. Reagan's early film career was marked by small roles in B-movies, but he eventually landed a contract with Warner Bros. Studios. He appeared in over 50 films during the 1930s and 1940s, including the popular "Knute Rockne, All American" and "Bedtime for Bonzo."

## Military service

In 1942, Reagan enlisted in the United States Army Reserve, where he served for three years during World War II. Due to his poor eyesight, Reagan was classified as "limited service only" and was assigned to the Army Air Forces' First Motion Picture Unit, where he produced training films and propaganda films.

## Screen Actors Guild presidency

Reagan became involved in the Screen Actors Guild (SAG) early in his career and served as the guild's president from 1947 to 1952 and again from 1959 to 1960. During his tenure as SAG president, Reagan helped to negotiate better pay and working conditions for actors.

## Marriages and children

Reagan married actress Jane Wyman in 1940, and the couple had two children, Maureen and Michael. The couple divorced in 1948, and Reagan married actress Nancy Davis in 1952. The couple had two children, Patricia and Ronald Jr.

## Television

In the 1950s, Reagan began working in television, hosting several game shows and appearing in various TV shows, including "General Electric Theater" and "Death Valley Days." Reagan's work in television helped to establish him as a household name and laid the groundwork for his future career in politics.

# Early political activities

## 1966 California gubernatorial election

In 1966, Reagan ran for governor of California, winning the Republican primary and going on to defeat Democratic incumbent Pat Brown in the general election. Reagan's campaign focused on issues such as taxation, education, and law and order.

# California governorship (1967–1975)

Reagan served as governor of California from 1967 to 1975. During his tenure, he implemented several conservative policies, including tax cuts and reductions in state spending. Reagan also took a tough stance on law and order, supporting the use of force to quell student protests and riots.

# Seeking the presidency (1975–1981)

## 1976 Republican primaries

In 1976, Reagan challenged incumbent President Gerald Ford for the Republican presidential nomination. Although Reagan lost the nomination, his campaign helped to establish him as a national figure and laid the groundwork for his future presidential campaigns.

## 1980 election

In 1980, Reagan ran for president again, this time winning the Republican nomination and going on to defeat Democratic incumbent Jimmy Carter in the general election. Reagan's campaign focused on issues such as taxation, inflation, and national security.

# Presidency (1981–1989)

## First inauguration

Reagan was inaugurated as the 40th President of the United States on January 20, 1981. In his inaugural address, Reagan called for a reduction in government spending and a return to traditional American values.

## "Reaganomics" and the economy

Reagan's economic policies, which became known as "Reaganomics," were based on the idea of supply-side economics. The policies included tax cuts, deregulation, and reductions in government spending.

### Taxation

Reagan implemented several major tax cuts during his presidency, including the Economic Recovery Tax Act of 1981 and the Tax Reform Act of 1986. The tax cuts helped to stimulate economic growth and reduce the national debt.

### Inflation and unemployment

Reagan's policies helped to reduce inflation and unemployment, which had been major problems during the 1970s. The inflation rate declined from 14.8% in 1980 to 4.1% in 1988, while the unemployment rate declined from 7.5% in 1980 to 5.3% in 1988.

### Government spending

Reagan implemented several reductions in government spending, including cuts to social programs and defense spending. The reductions helped to reduce the national debt and stimulate economic growth.

### Deregulation

Reagan implemented several major deregulation initiatives, including the deregulation of the banking and energy industries. The deregulation helped to stimulate economic growth and increase competition.

### Deficits

Despite the tax cuts and reductions in government spending, the national debt increased during Reagan's presidency, from $994 billion in 1980 to $2.1 trillion in 1988. The increase was due in part to the tax cuts and the costs of the Cold War.

## Assassination attempt

On March 30, 1981, Reagan was shot by John Hinckley Jr. outside the Washington Hilton Hotel in Washington, D.C. Reagan survived the attempt on his life and returned to duty as president.

## Supreme Court appointments

Reagan made several appointments to the Supreme Court, including Sandra Day O'Connor, William Rehnquist, Antonin Scalia, and Anthony Kennedy. The appointments helped to shape the court's conservative majority.

## Public sector labor union fights

Reagan clashed with public sector labor unions, including the Professional Air Traffic Controllers Organization (PATCO), which went on strike in 1981. Reagan fired the striking air traffic controllers and banned them from federal employment.

## Civil rights

Reagan's record on civil rights was mixed. He supported the Martin Luther King Jr. federal holiday, but he also opposed several civil rights bills, including the Civil Rights Act of 1982.

## War on drugs

Reagan launched a "war on drugs" in 1982, which included increased funding for law enforcement and anti-drug programs. The war on drugs helped to reduce drug use and trafficking, but it also led to increased incarceration rates.

## Escalation of the Cold War

Reagan's presidency was marked by an escalation of the Cold War, including a military buildup and increased tensions with the Soviet Union. The escalation helped to contribute to the eventual collapse of the Soviet Union.

## Invasion of Grenada

In 1983, Reagan ordered the invasion of Grenada, a small island nation in the Caribbean. The invasion was in response to a Marxist coup and the construction of a Soviet-funded airport.

## 1984 election

Reagan won re-election in 1984, defeating Democratic challenger Walter Mondale in a landslide. The election was marked by a strong economy and a popular president.

## Response to the AIDS epidemic

Reagan's response to the AIDS epidemic was slow, and he did not publicly address the issue until 1985. The delay in response contributed to the spread of the disease and criticism of the administration's handling of the epidemic.

## Addressing apartheid

Reagan's administration was criticized for its handling of apartheid in South Africa. Reagan vetoed several bills aimed at imposing sanctions on the South African government, but Congress overrode the vetoes.

## Libya bombing

In 1986, Reagan ordered the bombing of Libya in response to Libyan sponsorship of terrorism. The bombing helped to reduce Libyan support for terrorism.

## Iran–Contra affair

The Iran–Contra affair was a major scandal that emerged during Reagan's presidency. The scandal involved the sale of arms to Iran and the diversion of funds to support anti-Sandinista rebels in Nicaragua. Reagan's administration was criticized for its handling of the scandal.

## The USS Stark incident

In 1987, the USS Stark was attacked by an Iraqi missile, killing 37 American sailors. The incident was a major embarrassment for the administration and led to increased tensions with Iraq.

## Soviet decline and thaw in relations

During Reagan's presidency, the Soviet Union began to decline, and relations between the two superpowers began to thaw. The decline and thaw were due in part to Reagan's policies, including the military buildup and increased diplomatic efforts.

# Post-presidency (1989–2004)

## Support for Brady Bill

After leaving office, Reagan supported the Brady Bill, a gun control bill that was signed into law by President Bill Clinton in 1993.

## Alzheimer's disease

In 1994, Reagan was diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease, a degenerative brain disorder. Reagan's diagnosis helped to raise awareness of the disease and increase funding for research.

## Death and funeral

Reagan died on June 5, 2004, at the age of 93, due to complications from Alzheimer's disease. Reagan's funeral was a major event, with tributes from around the world.

# Legacy

## Historical reputation

Reagan's historical reputation is complex and multifaceted. He is remembered as a strong leader who helped to end the Cold War and stimulate economic growth. However, he is also criticized for his handling of social issues and the national debt.

## Political influence

Reagan's influence on American politics has been significant. He helped to shape the Republican Party's conservative agenda and inspired a generation of politicians, including George W. Bush and Donald Trump.

Siege of Mariupol

The Siege of Mariupol was a prolonged and intense military confrontation between Ukrainian forces and Russian-backed separatists, supported by the Russian military, during the war in Donbas. The city of Mariupol, located in the Donetsk Oblast of Ukraine, was a strategic port city and a key industrial center, making it a crucial target for both sides. The siege began in early 2014 and continued intermittently until 2022, with periods of relative calm punctuated by intense fighting and humanitarian crises.

# Background

Mariupol, a city of approximately 450,000 inhabitants, is located on the Sea of Azov, about 30 kilometers from the Russian border. Prior to the conflict, the city was a major industrial center, with a significant steel production facility, the Azovstal steel plant, and a major port. The city's location and economic importance made it a key prize for both Ukrainian and Russian-backed forces.

In 2014, following the Ukrainian Revolution and the subsequent annexation of Crimea by Russia, pro-Russian separatists declared the establishment of the Donetsk People's Republic (DPR) and the Luhansk People's Republic (LPR) in eastern Ukraine. The conflict escalated, with Ukrainian forces engaging in combat with separatist militias and Russian-backed forces.

# Advances to Mariupol

## Preliminary shelling and advance on the city

In August 2014, Russian-backed separatist forces, supported by the Russian military, launched a major offensive against Ukrainian forces in the Donetsk Oblast. The separatists made significant gains, capturing several key cities and towns, including Novoazovsk, a strategic town located about 30 kilometers east of Mariupol.

As the separatists advanced, they began to shell Mariupol, causing significant damage to the city's infrastructure and civilian casualties. Ukrainian forces, supported by volunteer militias, defended the city, but were largely outnumbered and outgunned.

## Mariupol surrounded

By September 2014, Mariupol was surrounded by separatist forces, with the city's access to the sea and its main supply routes cut off. The Ukrainian military launched a series of counterattacks, but were unable to break the separatist siege.

The city's residents suffered greatly during this period, with limited access to food, water, and medical supplies. The humanitarian situation deteriorated, with reports of looting, violence, and human rights abuses.

# Urban advances

## Russian push into the city

In February 2022, Russian forces, supported by separatist militias, launched a major offensive against Mariupol, with the aim of capturing the city and securing a land bridge between the DPR and Crimea.

The Russian military used advanced artillery, air power, and infantry to push into the city, causing widespread destruction and civilian casualties. Ukrainian forces defended the city, but were largely outnumbered and outgunned.

## Final pockets of resistance

By April 2022, Russian forces had captured most of the city, with Ukrainian forces retreating to the Azovstal steel plant, a heavily fortified facility located on the outskirts of the city.

The Ukrainian military, supported by volunteer militias, continued to resist, but were largely surrounded and cut off from the rest of Ukraine.

# Resistance in the Azovstal steel plant

## Withdrawal to Azovstal

In March 2022, Ukrainian forces withdrew to the Azovstal steel plant, a heavily fortified facility located on the outskirts of Mariupol. The plant, which had been damaged during the fighting, became a symbol of Ukrainian resistance against the Russian military.

The Ukrainian military, supported by volunteer militias, defended the plant, using its tunnels and bunkers to launch counterattacks against Russian forces.

## Siege of Azovstal

Russian forces besieged the Azovstal steel plant, using artillery, air power, and infantry to try and capture the facility. The Ukrainian military defended the plant, but were largely outnumbered and outgunned.

The humanitarian situation inside the plant deteriorated, with reports of limited access to food, water, and medical supplies.

## Evacuation of civilians

In April 2022, a humanitarian corridor was established, allowing civilians to evacuate the Azovstal steel plant. The evacuation was facilitated by the United Nations and the International Committee of the Red Cross.

However, the evacuation was not without controversy, with reports of Russian forces firing on civilians attempting to flee the plant.

## Ukrainian surrender

On May 20, 2022, Ukrainian forces surrendered the Azovstal steel plant to Russian forces, marking the end of the siege of Mariupol. The Ukrainian military had defended the city for over two months, but were ultimately unable to hold out against the Russian military.

# Aftermath

## Demolition of buildings and Russification of the city

Following the capture of Mariupol, Russian forces began to demolish buildings and infrastructure, with the aim of rebuilding the city in a Russian style.

The city's residents were forced to adapt to a new reality, with Russian language and culture becoming dominant.

## Last Ukrainian holdouts and prisoners of war

Some Ukrainian soldiers remained in hiding, continuing to resist the Russian occupation. However, many were captured and taken prisoner by Russian forces.

The treatment of Ukrainian prisoners of war was widely criticized, with reports of torture, abuse, and human rights violations.

## City government's role

The city government of Mariupol was forced to cooperate with Russian authorities, with the city's mayor and other officials being replaced by pro-Russian appointees.

The city's residents were forced to adapt to a new reality, with Russian language and culture becoming dominant.

## Claimed cholera outbreak

In June 2022, Ukrainian officials claimed that a cholera outbreak had occurred in Mariupol, with reports of limited access to clean water and sanitation.

The Russian military denied the claims, but the humanitarian situation in the city remained dire.

## Ukrainian missile strikes

In July 2022, Ukrainian forces launched a series of missile strikes against Russian-occupied Mariupol, targeting military facilities and infrastructure.

The strikes were seen as a response to the Russian occupation of the city, and the humanitarian crisis that had unfolded.

2023 Scotties Tournament of Hearts

The 2023 Scotties Tournament of Hearts was a women's curling tournament that took place from February 17 to 26, 2023, at the Sandman Centre in Kamloops, British Columbia. The event was the 41st edition of the Scotties Tournament of Hearts, Canada's national women's curling championship. Sixteen teams, representing the ten provinces and three territories of Canada, plus three wild-card teams, competed in a round-robin format, with the top four teams advancing to the championship round.

article:
Francis Drake
================

Sir Francis Drake was an English sea captain, privateer, and naval commander who is best known for being the first Englishman to circumnavigate the globe. He played a significant role in the defeat of the Spanish Armada and was a prominent figure in the Elizabethan era.

Birth and Early Years
---------------------

Francis Drake was born in 1540 in Tavistock, Devon, England. His father, Edmund Drake, was a tenant farmer who later became a Protestant minister. Francis was the eldest of twelve children, and his family was considered to be of moderate means. Little is known about Drake's childhood, but it is believed that he was educated at a local school in Tavistock.

Early Career at Sea
--------------------

Drake's early career at sea began when he was apprenticed to a merchant shipowner in Plymouth. He quickly rose through the ranks and became a master mariner in his own right. In the 1560s, Drake made several voyages to the Caribbean and the west coast of Africa, where he became involved in the slave trade.

### Slave Trade

Drake's involvement in the slave trade was a significant aspect of his early career. He made several voyages to the Caribbean, where he would capture Spanish ships and sell their cargo, including slaves. Drake's activities in the slave trade were not unusual for the time, but they have been widely criticized by modern historians.

### Expedition of 1572–1573

In 1572, Drake embarked on an expedition to the Caribbean with a fleet of three ships. The expedition was a private venture, and Drake's goal was to capture Spanish ships and plunder their cargo. The expedition was successful, and Drake returned to England with a significant amount of treasure.

### Rathlin Island Massacre

In 1575, Drake was involved in the Rathlin Island massacre, in which a group of English privateers attacked and killed several hundred Scottish and Irish mercenaries who were stationed on the island. The massacre was widely condemned, and Drake's role in it has been the subject of much debate among historians.

Circumnavigation (1577–1580)
---------------------------

Drake's most famous voyage was his circumnavigation of the globe, which took place from 1577 to 1580. The voyage was a private venture, and Drake's goal was to capture Spanish ships and plunder their cargo.

### Execution of Thomas Doughty

In 1578, Drake had one of his officers, Thomas Doughty, executed for mutiny. The execution was a significant event in the voyage, and it marked a turning point in Drake's relationship with his crew.

### Entering the Pacific (1578)

In 1578, Drake's fleet entered the Pacific Ocean, becoming the first English ships to do so. The expedition was a significant milestone in the history of exploration, and it marked the beginning of English involvement in the Pacific.

### Raids on Spanish American West Coast

Drake's fleet raided several Spanish towns on the west coast of South America, including Valparaíso and Callao. The raids were successful, and Drake captured a significant amount of treasure.

### Coast of California: Nova Albion (1579)

In 1579, Drake's fleet arrived on the coast of California, which he claimed for England and named Nova Albion. The expedition was a significant event in the history of California, and it marked the beginning of English involvement in the region.

### Across the Pacific and around Africa

Drake's fleet sailed across the Pacific and around Africa, becoming the first English ships to circumnavigate the globe. The voyage was a significant achievement, and it marked a major milestone in the history of exploration.

### Return to Plymouth (1580)

Drake's fleet returned to Plymouth in 1580, where they were greeted as heroes. The voyage had been a significant success, and Drake had captured a large amount of treasure.

### Knighthood and Arms

Drake was knighted by Queen Elizabeth I in 1581, and he was granted a coat of arms. The knighthood was a significant honor, and it marked a major milestone in Drake's career.

Political Career
----------------

Drake's political career began in the 1580s, when he was elected to Parliament. He served in Parliament for several years, during which time he became a prominent advocate for the English navy.

Great Expedition to America
---------------------------

In 1585, Drake led a great expedition to America, which was intended to establish an English settlement in the New World. The expedition was a significant failure, and Drake returned to England with a large number of casualties.

Conflict with the Spanish Armada
--------------------------------

Drake's most famous conflict was with the Spanish Armada, which took place in 1588. The Armada was a massive fleet of Spanish ships that was intended to invade England and overthrow Queen Elizabeth I.

### Cádiz Raid

In 1587, Drake led a raid on the Spanish port of Cádiz, which was a significant blow to the Spanish navy. The raid was a major success, and it marked a turning point in the conflict with the Spanish Armada.

### Defeat of the Spanish Armada

In 1588, Drake played a significant role in the defeat of the Spanish Armada. The Armada was a massive fleet of Spanish ships that was intended to invade England and overthrow Queen Elizabeth I. The defeat of the Armada was a major turning point in English history, and it marked the beginning of English supremacy at sea.

### English Armada

In 1589, Drake led an English Armada to Portugal, which was intended to overthrow the Spanish-backed government. The expedition was a significant failure, and Drake returned to England with a large number of casualties.

Defeats and Death
-----------------

Drake's later years were marked by a series of defeats and setbacks. He died in 1596, at the age of 56, of a fever that he contracted while on a voyage to the Caribbean.

Family and Heritage
-------------------

Drake was married twice, first to Mary Newman and then to Elizabeth Sydenham. He had no children, but he was known to be a generous patron of his relatives.

Legacy and Honours
-------------------

Drake's legacy is still celebrated today, and he is remembered as one of the greatest English heroes of all time. He was a pioneer of English exploration and a major figure in the defeat of the Spanish Armada.

### Geographical Names

Drake's name is still remembered in geographical names around the world, including Drake's Passage, which is a strait at the tip of South America, and Drake Bay, which is a bay in California.

article:
Ice Spice

Ice Spice is an American rapper and songwriter from the Bronx, New York. Born Isis Naija Gaston, she rose to prominence in the hip-hop scene with her unique style and lyrical delivery, quickly gaining a massive following and critical acclaim.

#Early life and education

Ice Spice was born on January 23, 2000, in the Bronx, New York. She grew up in a low-income household with her mother and younger brother. Spice's early life was marked by hardship, with her family struggling to make ends meet. Despite these challenges, she found solace in music, particularly hip-hop, which would eventually become her passion. Spice attended high school in the Bronx, where she began writing her own raps and performing at local talent shows. After completing high school, she decided to pursue a career in music, inspired by her idols, such as Nicki Minaj and Lil' Kim.

#Career

##2021–2022: Career beginnings

Ice Spice started her music career in 2021, releasing her debut single "Bully Freestyle" on SoundCloud. The song gained moderate attention, but it was her follow-up single "No Clarity" that started to build a buzz around her name. Spice's early music was characterized by her raw energy, streetwise lyrics, and distinctive flow. She continued to release music throughout 2022, gradually building a loyal fan base and attracting attention from industry insiders.

##2023–present: Breakthrough with Like…?

In January 2023, Ice Spice released her breakout single "Munch (Feelin' U)," which quickly went viral on social media platforms. The song's success led to her signing with 10K Projects and Capitol Records. On January 20, 2023, Spice released her debut EP, Like…?, which debuted at number 15 on the US Billboard 200 chart. The EP received widespread critical acclaim, with many praising Spice's lyrical skill and unique style. The success of Like…? established Ice Spice as a rising star in the hip-hop world, with many predicting a bright future for the young rapper.

#Artistry

##Musical and lyrical style

Ice Spice's music is characterized by her raw, unapologetic lyrics and distinctive flow. Her style blends elements of drill, trap, and old-school hip-hop, with a focus on storytelling and vivid descriptions of her life experiences. Spice's lyrics often touch on themes of poverty, street life, and female empowerment, offering a unique perspective on the world around her.

##Influences

Ice Spice has cited a range of influences on her music, including Nicki Minaj, Lil' Kim, and Lauryn Hill. She has also mentioned being inspired by male rappers such as JAY-Z and The Notorious B.I.G. Spice's music is also influenced by her Bronx upbringing, with many of her songs referencing her hometown and the experiences she had growing up there.

#Personal life

Ice Spice is known for her outgoing personality and strong online presence. She is active on social media platforms, where she regularly engages with her fans and shares updates about her life and music. Spice is also known for her fashion sense, often incorporating bold, eye-catching outfits into her music videos and live performances.

##Feuds & controversies

Ice Spice has been involved in several high-profile feuds and controversies throughout her career. In 2022, she was involved in a public spat with fellow rapper Lil Tjay, with the two exchanging diss tracks and insults on social media. Spice has also faced criticism for her lyrics, with some accusing her of promoting violence and misogyny. However, she has maintained that her music is a reflection of her experiences and the world around her, and that she is simply telling her story.

Coco Lee
================

Coco Lee (born Ferren Lee-Kong; January 17, 1975 – July 5, 2023) was a Hong Kong-born American singer, songwriter, record producer, and actress. She was one of the most successful and influential Asian artists of all time, with a career spanning over three decades. Lee was known for her powerful vocals, energetic live performances, and versatility in multiple languages, including Cantonese, Mandarin, English, and Japanese.

Early Life
-----------

Coco Lee was born Ferren Lee-Kong on January 17, 1975, in Hong Kong to a Chinese father and a Eurasian mother. She moved to the United States with her family at a young age and grew up in San Francisco, California. Lee developed an interest in music and singing at an early age, influenced by her mother, who was a singer and a pianist. She began performing in local talent shows and competitions, showcasing her vocal talent and charisma.

Career
--------

### Career beginnings and Sony Music: 1993–1998

Coco Lee's music career began in 1993 when she was signed by Sony Music Entertainment. She released her debut album, "Love from Now On," in 1994, which was a moderate success in Hong Kong and Taiwan. Lee's early music style was influenced by Western pop and R&B, but she soon began to incorporate traditional Chinese elements into her music. Her second album, " Promise," was released in 1995 and featured a more mature and experimental sound.

In 1996, Lee released her third album, "Believe in Love," which included the hit single "You're in My Heart." The album was a commercial success in Asia and established Lee as a rising star in the music industry. She continued to release successful albums throughout the late 1990s, including "Sincere" (1997) and "Di Da Di" (1998).

### International collaborations and English debut: 1998–2005

In 1998, Coco Lee began to explore international collaborations, working with American producers and songwriters. She released her first English-language single, "Do You Want My Love," which was featured on the soundtrack of the film "Lethal Weapon 4." Lee's English debut album, "Just No Other Way," was released in 1999 and included the hit singles "Can't Get You Out of My Head" and "Wherever You Go."

Throughout the early 2000s, Lee continued to release successful albums in both Cantonese and English. Her album "Exodus" (2001) featured the hit single "So Crazy," while her album "All Natural" (2003) included the hit single "Hypnotize." Lee's music style during this period was influenced by Western pop and R&B, but she also experimented with traditional Chinese elements and electronic dance music.

### Second English album and Warner Music: 2005–2011

In 2005, Coco Lee signed with Warner Music and released her second English-language album, "Just Want You." The album featured the hit singles "Shake It Up" and "I'm Not Perfect." Lee's music style during this period was more experimental and edgy, incorporating elements of rock and electronic dance music.

Throughout the late 2000s, Lee continued to release successful albums in both Cantonese and English. Her album "1087" (2009) featured the hit single "BYOB," while her album "East to West" (2011) included the hit single "Love Now."

### New album and final projects before death: 2011–2023

In 2011, Coco Lee released her album "East to West," which featured a more mature and introspective sound. Lee's music style during this period was influenced by Western pop and R&B, but she also experimented with traditional Chinese elements and electronic dance music.

Throughout the 2010s, Lee continued to release successful albums and singles, including "Illuminate" (2013), "Rebirth" (2015), and "All of Me" (2017). Lee's final album, "Luminous," was released in 2020 and featured the hit single "Unstoppable."

Personal Life
-------------

Coco Lee was married to Bruce Dou, a Chinese businessman, from 2011 until her death in 2023. The couple had no children together. Lee was known for her philanthropic work, particularly in the area of children's education and healthcare. She was also a vocal advocate for women's rights and LGBTQ+ rights.

Health Issues
-------------

Coco Lee struggled with mental health issues throughout her life, including depression and anxiety. She was open about her struggles and used her platform to raise awareness and reduce stigma around mental health issues.

Death
------

Coco Lee died on July 5, 2023, at the age of 48, due to complications from a long-term illness. The news of her death was met with an outpouring of tributes and condolences from fans and fellow artists around the world.

### Services and tributes

A memorial service was held for Lee in Hong Kong, attended by her family, friends, and fellow artists. A tribute concert was also held in her honor, featuring performances by fellow artists and friends.

### Aftermath

Following Lee's death, several leaked clips and unreleased music were shared online by fans and fellow artists. The clips and music were met with an outpouring of support and tributes from fans around the world.

#### Leaked clips and Sing! China

In the days following Lee's death, several leaked clips of her performances on the Chinese reality TV show "Sing! China" were shared online. The clips featured Lee's powerful vocals and energetic performances, and were met with an outpouring of support and tributes from fans around the world.

Legacy
--------

Coco Lee's legacy is that of a trailblazing artist who broke down cultural and linguistic barriers in the music industry. She was a true icon and inspiration to fans around the world, and her music continues to be celebrated and enjoyed by generations of fans.

Philanthropy
------------

Coco Lee was a dedicated philanthropist, particularly in the area of children's education and healthcare. She worked with several charitable organizations throughout her career, including the United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF) and the World Health Organization (WHO).

Artistry
---------

Coco Lee was a talented and versatile artist, known for her powerful vocals, energetic live performances, and experimentation with multiple languages and music styles. She was a true innovator and trailblazer in the music industry, and her artistry continues to be celebrated and enjoyed by fans around the world.

article:
2022 Ontario general election

The 2022 Ontario general election was held on June 2, 2022, to elect the 124 members of the 43rd Parliament of Ontario. The Progressive Conservative Party of Ontario, led by Doug Ford, won a second consecutive majority government.

#Background

The 2018 Ontario general election saw the Progressive Conservative Party of Ontario, led by Doug Ford, win a majority government with 76 seats. The New Democratic Party, led by Andrea Horwath, formed the official opposition with 40 seats, while the Liberal Party of Ontario, led by Kathleen Wynne, lost official party status with only 7 seats. The Green Party of Ontario, led by Mike Schreiner, won its first ever seat in the Ontario legislature.

#Timeline

##2018

The 42nd Parliament of Ontario was dissolved on May 9, 2018, and the 2018 Ontario general election was held on June 7, 2018.

##2020

In 2020, the Ontario government passed Bill 218, which amended the Election Act to move the fixed election date from October 2022 to June 2022.

##2021

In 2021, the Ontario government passed Bill 254, which amended the Election Act to increase the number of seats in the Ontario legislature from 122 to 124.

##2022

The 42nd Parliament of Ontario was dissolved on May 4, 2022, and the 2022 Ontario general election was held on June 2, 2022.

#Campaign period

The campaign period for the 2022 Ontario general election began on May 4, 2022, and ended on June 1, 2022.

##Candidates not standing for reelection

Several sitting MPPs announced that they would not be standing for reelection in 2022, including:

* Liberal MPPs: Marie-France Lalonde, Nathalie Des Rosiers, Michael Coteau
* NDP MPPs: Jennifer French, Joel Harden, Rima Berns-McGown
* PC MPPs: Bill Walker, Roman Baber, Belinda Karahalios

##Party slogans

* Progressive Conservative Party of Ontario: "Get it done"
* New Democratic Party: "Better is possible"
* Liberal Party of Ontario: "A new way forward"
* Green Party of Ontario: "It's time for a change"

##Debates

Several debates were held during the campaign period, including a televised leaders' debate on May 16, 2022.

##Issues

Some of the key issues during the campaign included:

* The COVID-19 pandemic and the government's response to it
* The economy and job creation
* Healthcare and the state of the healthcare system
* Education and the state of the education system
* Climate change and the environment

##Summary

The campaign period was marked by a focus on the key issues of the pandemic, the economy, and healthcare. The leaders of the three main parties, Doug Ford, Andrea Horwath, and Steven Del Duca, traveled the province and participated in debates and other campaign events.

##Endorsements

Several unions and organizations endorsed candidates during the campaign, including:

* The Ontario Federation of Labour, which endorsed the NDP
* The Ontario Chamber of Commerce, which endorsed the PCs
* The Ontario Medical Association, which endorsed the PCs

#Opinion polls

##Campaign polls

Several opinion polls were conducted during the campaign period, including:

* A poll by Ipsos, which showed the PCs leading the NDP by 5 points
* A poll by Abacus Data, which showed the PCs leading the NDP by 7 points
* A poll by EKOS Research, which showed the PCs leading the NDP by 10 points

##Pre-campaign polls

Several opinion polls were conducted before the campaign period, including:

* A poll by Ipsos, which showed the PCs leading the NDP by 10 points
* A poll by Abacus Data, which showed the PCs leading the NDP by 12 points
* A poll by EKOS Research, which showed the PCs leading the NDP by 15 points

#Results

The results of the 2022 Ontario general election were as follows:

##Synopsis of results

* The Progressive Conservative Party of Ontario won a majority government with 83 seats.
* The New Democratic Party formed the official opposition with 31 seats.
* The Liberal Party of Ontario won 8 seats.
* The Green Party of Ontario won 1 seat.

##Post-election pendulum

The post-election pendulum shows that the PCs won 47 seats with a margin of 10% or less, while the NDP won 15 seats with a margin of 10% or less.

##Results summary by region

* The PCs won 44 seats in the 905 region, 23 seats in the 416 region, and 16 seats in the rest of the province.
* The NDP won 15 seats in the 416 region, 10 seats in the 905 region, and 6 seats in the rest of the province.

##Detailed results

The detailed results for each riding are as follows:

* The PCs won 83 seats, including:
	+ 44 seats in the 905 region
	+ 23 seats in the 416 region
	+ 16 seats in the rest of the province
* The NDP won 31 seats, including:
	+ 15 seats in the 416 region
	+ 10 seats in the 905 region
	+ 6 seats in the rest of the province
* The Liberals won 8 seats, including:
	+ 5 seats in the 416 region
	+ 2 seats in the 905 region
	+ 1 seat in the rest of the province
* The Greens won 1 seat, including:
	+ 1 seat in the 416 region

##Summary analysis

The results of the election show that the PCs won a majority government, while the NDP formed the official opposition. The Liberals and Greens won fewer seats than they had in the previous election.

##Most marginal 2-way and 3-way contests

The most marginal 2-way and 3-way contests were as follows:

* The riding of Brampton North, which was won by the PCs with a margin of 0.2%
* The riding of Ottawa West—Nepean, which was won by the NDP with a margin of 0.4%
* The riding of Scarborough—Guildwood, which was won by the Liberals with a margin of 0.5%

##Significant results among independent and minor party candidates

Several independent and minor party candidates won significant numbers of votes, including:

* The leader of the Ontario Libertarian Party, who won 1.3% of the vote in the riding of Lanark—Frontenac—Kingston
* The leader of the Ontario Communist Party, who won 0.8% of the vote in the riding of Ottawa Centre

##Seats changing hands

Several seats changed hands during the election, including:

* The riding of Brampton North, which was won by the PCs after being held by the NDP
* The riding of Ottawa West—Nepean, which was won by the NDP after being held by the Liberals
* The riding of Scarborough—Guildwood, which was won by the Liberals after being held by the PCs

* EKOS Research

* Elections Ontario

* New Democratic Party
* Liberal Party of Ontario

article:
Vaathi
================

Vaathi is a 2023 Indian Tamil-language action drama film written and directed by Venky Atluri. The film stars Dhanush and Samyuktha Menon, with Sai Kumar, Tanikella Bharani, and Ken Karunas in supporting roles. The movie follows the story of a young teacher who becomes embroiled in a conflict with the management of a corporate educational institution.

Plot
-----

The film begins with Balamurugan (Dhanush), a young and idealistic teacher who joins a corporate educational institution called Arvind Bharti. Balamurugan is passionate about teaching and wants to make a positive impact on his students' lives. However, he soon realizes that the institution is more focused on generating profits than providing quality education.

As Balamurugan tries to implement his own teaching methods and connect with his students on a personal level, he faces resistance from the institution's management. The management, led by the ruthless and cunning Arvind Bharti (Sai Kumar), sees Balamurugan as a threat to their profits and tries to silence him.

Despite the challenges, Balamurugan continues to fight for what he believes in, inspiring his students to think critically and challenge the status quo. As the conflict between Balamurugan and the management escalates, the film builds towards a dramatic climax.

Cast

* Dhanush as Balamurugan
* Samyuktha Menon as Aradhana
* Sai Kumar as Arvind Bharti
* Tanikella Bharani as Minister
* Ken Karunas as Bharti's son

Production
------------

### Development

The film was first announced in 2020, with Dhanush and Venky Atluri teaming up for the first time. The script was written by Atluri, who had previously directed films like Tholiprema and Mr. Majnu. The film's title, Vaathi, was announced in 2022, along with the release of the film's first look poster.

### Filming

Principal photography began in 2022, with the film being shot in various locations across India. The film's cinematography was handled by J.Yuvraj, who had previously worked on films like Kaithi and Master. The film's editing was done by Navin Nooli, who had previously worked on films like Jersey and Ala Vaikunthapurramuloo.

Music
------

The film's music was composed by G.V. Prakash Kumar, who had previously worked on films like Darling and Asuran. The film's soundtrack features five songs, with lyrics written by Vivek and Poetu Dhanush. The film's score was well-received by critics and audiences alike, with many praising the composer's use of folk elements and traditional instruments.

Release
--------

### Theatrical

The film was released theatrically on February 17, 2023, in Tamil Nadu and other parts of India. The film received a positive response from audiences, with many praising the film's message and performances. The film was also released in Telugu as Sir, with a dubbed version being released in other languages.

### Home media

The film was released on Amazon Prime Video on March 17, 2023, with the film being made available to stream in Tamil, Telugu, and other languages.

Reception
----------

The film received generally positive reviews from critics, with many praising the film's message and performances. The film was praised for its portrayal of the education system and the challenges faced by teachers and students alike. The film's music and cinematography were also praised, with many calling it one of the best films of the year.

article:
Joe Biden classified documents incident

The Joe Biden classified documents incident refers to the discovery of classified documents in the possession of Joe Biden, the 46th President of the United States, at his home in Wilmington, Delaware, and at the Penn Biden Center in Washington, D.C. The incident has sparked controversy and raised questions about the handling of classified information by the President and his team.

#Background

As Vice President under Barack Obama, Joe Biden had access to classified information, which is typically stored in secure facilities and handled by authorized personnel. After leaving office in 2017, Biden established the Penn Biden Center, a think tank affiliated with the University of Pennsylvania, where he served as the Benjamin Franklin Presidential Practice Professor. The center was located in a secure building in Washington, D.C., and Biden would occasionally visit the center to work on various projects.

#Discoveries and other developments

##First batch of documents

In November 2022, Biden's lawyers discovered a batch of classified documents at the Penn Biden Center, which were reportedly from his time as Vice President. The documents were said to be related to Ukraine, Iran, and the United Kingdom. Biden's lawyers immediately notified the National Archives and Records Administration (NARA), which took possession of the documents.

##DOJ letter to Bob Bauer

On November 9, 2022, Attorney General Merrick Garland wrote to Bob Bauer, a lawyer and former White House counsel, informing him that the Justice Department was investigating the matter. Garland asked Bauer to confirm that the documents had been found and to provide any additional information about their discovery.

##Second batch of documents

On December 20, 2022, Biden's lawyers discovered a second batch of classified documents at his home in Wilmington, Delaware. The documents were reportedly from his time as Vice President and were related to topics such as Ukraine, Iran, and China.

##FBI search of Biden's Wilmington home

On January 20, 2023, the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) conducted a search of Biden's home in Wilmington, Delaware, in connection with the investigation into the classified documents. The search was reportedly voluntary, and Biden's lawyers cooperated with the FBI.

##Other searches

In addition to the FBI search of Biden's home, the Justice Department also searched the Penn Biden Center in Washington, D.C. for any additional classified documents.

#Initial responses

##Biden and his legal team

Biden's lawyers stated that the President had cooperated fully with the investigation and had taken steps to ensure that any classified documents were properly stored and handled. Biden himself said that he was "surprised" to learn that the documents had been found at his home and at the Penn Biden Center.

##Elected officials

###Republican elected officials

Many Republican elected officials criticized Biden for the discovery of the classified documents, with some calling for his impeachment. Senator Lindsey Graham (R-SC) said that Biden's handling of the documents was "inexcusable" and that he should be held accountable.

###Democratic elected officials

Democratic elected officials generally defended Biden, with some arguing that the discovery of the classified documents was an honest mistake. Senator Dick Durbin (D-IL) said that Biden had "taken responsibility" for the mistake and that the investigation should be allowed to proceed.

##Media analysis

The discovery of the classified documents sparked widespread media coverage, with many outlets analyzing the implications of the incident. Some commentators argued that the incident raised questions about Biden's judgment and his ability to handle sensitive information.

##Misinformation

In the days following the discovery of the classified documents, misinformation about the incident spread rapidly on social media. Some users claimed that Biden had intentionally mishandled the documents or that the incident was part of a larger conspiracy.

##Discovery of classified documents at Mike Pence's residence

In February 2023, it was reported that classified documents had also been found at the residence of former Vice President Mike Pence. The documents were reportedly from Pence's time as Vice President under Donald Trump.

#Investigations

##Special counsel

2023 PDC World Cup of Darts

The 2023 PDC World Cup of Darts was the 12th edition of the PDC World Cup of Darts, a major international darts tournament organized by the Professional Darts Corporation (PDC). The event took place from June 15 to 18, 2023, at the Eissporthalle in Frankfurt, Germany.

# Format

The 2023 PDC World Cup of Darts followed the same format as the previous year's event. The tournament featured 40 teams, each representing a different country, competing in a combination of doubles and singles matches. The teams were divided into 10 groups of four teams each, with the top two teams from each group advancing to the knockout stage.

## Group Stage

The group stage took place on June 15 and 16, with each team playing three matches against the other teams in their group. The matches were played in a best-of-nine-legs format, with the team winning the most legs winning the match. The top two teams from each group advanced to the knockout stage, with the group winners seeded 1-10 and the runners-up seeded 11-20.

## Knockout Stage

The knockout stage took place on June 17 and 18, with the seeded teams facing off against each other in a best-of-seven-legs format. The quarterfinals and semifinals were played on June 17, with the winners advancing to the final. The final was played on June 18, with the winning team crowned the 2023 PDC World Cup of Darts champions.

2023 AFC U-17 Asian Cup qualification

The 2023 AFC U-17 Asian Cup qualification is an international football competition which will determine the participating teams for the 2023 AFC U-17 Asian Cup. A total of 47 teams will compete in the qualifying competition, which will be held in 2023.

# Format changes

The format of the competition has been changed from the previous edition. The top 4 teams in the 2020 AFC U-16 Championship will automatically qualify for the 2023 AFC U-17 Asian Cup, while the remaining teams will compete in the qualifying competition. The qualifying competition will consist of 10 groups of 4 teams each, with the top team from each group and the 6 best runners-up advancing to the final tournament.

# Draw

The draw for the qualifying competition was held on 24 May 2022 in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. The 47 teams were divided into 5 pots based on their performance in the 2020 AFC U-16 Championship and the 2018 AFC U-16 Championship. The teams were then drawn into 10 groups of 4 teams each.

# Player eligibility

To be eligible to participate in the 2023 AFC U-17 Asian Cup qualification, a player must have been born on or after 1 January 2006.

# Format

The qualifying competition will consist of 10 groups of 4 teams each. Each team will play the other teams in their group once, with the top team from each group and the 6 best runners-up advancing to the final tournament.

## Tiebreakers

article:
Battle of Kapyong

The Battle of Kapyong was a pivotal battle fought during the Korean War, between United Nations Command (UNC) forces, primarily composed of Australian, Canadian, and New Zealand troops, and the Chinese People's Volunteer Army (PVA). The battle took place from 22 to 25 April 1951, in the Kapyong Valley, South Korea, and was a decisive UNC victory.

#Background

##Military situation

In the spring of 1951, the Korean War was in its second year. The UNC, led by General Matthew Ridgway, had been pushing the PVA back since the Chinese intervention in November 1950. However, the PVA had regrouped and was preparing to launch a massive spring offensive, aimed at recapturing the strategic city of Seoul. The UNC was aware of the impending attack and had been reinforcing its positions along the 38th parallel, the pre-war border between North and South Korea.

#Chinese Spring Offensive

##Preparations

The PVA had been preparing for its spring offensive since February 1951. The Chinese had assembled a massive force, consisting of over 700,000 troops, and had been secretly moving them into position along the 38th parallel. The PVA had also been conducting a series of probes and reconnaissance missions, aimed at testing the UNC defenses and identifying weak points.

##Launch of Chinese Spring Offensive

On 22 April 1951, the PVA launched its spring offensive, with a massive artillery barrage and simultaneous attacks along the entire 38th parallel. The UNC was caught off guard, and many of its positions were quickly overrun. The PVA made rapid gains, pushing the UNC back and creating a series of gaps in the line.

##South Korean withdrawal, 22–23 April 1951

As the PVA advanced, the South Korean army (ROK) began to falter. Many ROK units were poorly trained and equipped, and they were quickly overwhelmed by the sheer size and ferocity of the PVA attack. On 22 April, the ROK 6th Division, which was holding the Kapyong Valley, began to withdraw in disarray. The withdrawal quickly turned into a rout, as the ROK troops abandoned their positions and fled south.

#Australian 3 RAR defence of Hill 504, 23–24 April 1951

##Night battle

As the ROK troops withdrew, the Australian 3rd Battalion, Royal Australian Regiment (3 RAR), which was holding Hill 504, a strategic position overlooking the Kapyong Valley, found itself isolated and surrounded. On the night of 23 April, the PVA launched a fierce attack on Hill 504, using mortars, machine guns, and infantry. The Australians held their ground, but they were vastly outnumbered and outgunned.

##Day battle

On 24 April, the PVA launched a second attack on Hill 504, this time using tanks and infantry. The Australians were again heavily outnumbered, but they held their ground, using their artillery and mortar fire to devastating effect. The PVA attack was eventually repelled, but the Australians had suffered heavy casualties.

##3 RAR withdraws

As the day wore on, the Australians realized that their position was untenable. They were surrounded, outnumbered, and outgunned, and they were in danger of being cut off and annihilated. On the evening of 24 April, the 3 RAR withdrew from Hill 504, under the cover of darkness and artillery fire.

#Canadian 2 PPCLI last stand on Hill 677, 24–25 April 1951

##Preparations

As the Australians withdrew from Hill 504, the Canadian 2nd Battalion, Princess Patricia's Canadian Light Infantry (2 PPCLI), which was holding Hill 677, a strategic position overlooking the Kapyong Valley, prepared for its own last stand. The Canadians knew that they were in a precarious position, surrounded by the PVA and outnumbered.

##Night battle

On the night of 24 April, the PVA launched a fierce attack on Hill 677, using mortars, machine guns, and infantry. The Canadians held their ground, but they were vastly outnumbered and outgunned. The battle raged on for hours, with the Canadians fighting for every inch of ground.

##Final 2 PPCLI Operations

As the night wore on, the Canadians realized that their position was untenable. They were surrounded, outnumbered, and outgunned, and they were in danger of being cut off and annihilated. On the morning of 25 April, the 2 PPCLI launched a series of desperate counterattacks, aimed at breaking through the PVA lines and linking up with the rest of the UNC forces. The counterattacks were successful, and the Canadians were eventually able to withdraw from Hill 677, under the cover of artillery fire.

#Aftermath

##Summary and casualties

The Battle of Kapyong was a decisive UNC victory, but it came at a heavy cost. The UNC had suffered over 1,000 casualties, including 400 killed, while the PVA had lost an estimated 10,000 troops. The battle had also marked a turning point in the Korean War, as the PVA had been repelled and the UNC had gained the initiative.

##Awards

The Battle of Kapyong was one of the most decorated battles of the Korean War. The Australians, Canadians, and New Zealanders had all fought with distinction, and many of their troops had been awarded medals for bravery. The battle had also marked the first time that the Australian, Canadian, and New Zealand armies had fought together, and it had forged a lasting bond between the three nations.

##Subsequent operations

The Battle of Kapyong marked the beginning of a series of UNC operations aimed at driving the PVA back and recapturing the strategic city of Seoul. The UNC launched a series of attacks, including Operation Commando and Operation Ripper, which eventually pushed the PVA back and secured the city of Seoul. The Korean War would continue for another two years, but the Battle of Kapyong had marked a decisive turning point in the conflict.

article:
The Peel Group
================

The Peel Group is a British investment group that operates in various sectors, including infrastructure, transport, real estate, and energy. The company has a significant presence in the United Kingdom, with a portfolio of assets that span multiple industries.

History
--------

### Name and listings

The Peel Group was founded by John Whittaker, who is still the company's chairman. The group's name is derived from the River Mersey's Peel Channel, which runs through the company's early investments in Liverpool. The company is headquartered in Manchester and is privately owned, with a complex structure of subsidiaries and investments.

### Early acquisitions

The Peel Group's early acquisitions focused on the Liverpool Docks and the Manchester Ship Canal. The company's strategic investments in these areas established it as a key player in the UK's maritime industry.

### Manchester Ship Canal

The Manchester Ship Canal is one of the Peel Group's most significant investments. The company acquired the canal in 1987 and has since invested heavily in its development and expansion. The canal is a vital transportation link between the Port of Liverpool and the industrial heartland of Manchester.

### Trafford Centre

The Trafford Centre is a large shopping and entertainment complex located in Greater Manchester. The Peel Group developed the centre, which opened in 1998 and has since become one of the UK's most popular retail destinations.

### Airports

The Peel Group has a significant presence in the UK's aviation industry, with investments in several airports, including Liverpool John Lennon Airport, Doncaster Sheffield Airport, and Durham Tees Valley Airport.

### Ports

The company's maritime interests extend beyond the Manchester Ship Canal, with investments in several UK ports, including the Port of Liverpool, the Port of Heysham, and the Port of Great Yarmouth.

### MediaCityUK

MediaCityUK is a major media and technology hub located in Salford, Greater Manchester. The Peel Group developed the site, which is home to several major media organizations, including the BBC and ITV.

### Pinewood Studios

The Peel Group acquired Pinewood Studios, a major film and television production facility, in 2001. The studio has hosted several high-profile productions, including the James Bond and Star Wars franchises.

### Energy

The company has invested in several renewable energy projects, including wind farms and biomass power plants.

### Retail and leisure

The Peel Group's retail and leisure portfolio includes several shopping centres and entertainment complexes, including the Trafford Centre and the Lowry arts centre.

### Housing

The company has also invested in residential development, with several housing projects across the UK.

Business structure
-----------------

The Peel Group's business structure is complex, with a network of subsidiaries and investments. The company is privately owned, with John Whittaker serving as chairman.

Controversies
-------------

The Peel Group has been involved in several controversies over the years, including concerns over environmental impact, tax evasion, and excessive influence.

### Hunterston Parc

The company's plans to develop a nuclear power station at Hunterston Parc in Scotland have been met with opposition from local residents and environmental groups.

### Chat Moss

The Peel Group's plans to develop a major logistics hub on the Chat Moss peat bog in Greater Manchester have been criticized by environmental groups, who argue that the development will damage the area's ecosystem.

### Biomass imports

The company's biomass power plants have been criticized for importing wood pellets from the United States, which has raised concerns over carbon emissions and deforestation.

### Car park fines

The Peel Group has been criticized for its aggressive car park fining policies, with several motorists claiming that they have been unfairly penalized.

### Hunterston fatality

In 2019, a worker was killed at the Hunterston Parc nuclear power station, which is owned by the Peel Group.

### Flying Phantom

The company's plans to develop a new flying boat service on the River Mersey have been met with skepticism by local residents, who argue that the service will be noisy and disrupt the area's ecosystem.

### Fracking collusion

The Peel Group has been accused of colluding with fracking companies to develop shale gas reserves in the UK.

### Congestion charge

The company's plans to introduce a congestion charge in several UK cities have been met with opposition from motorists, who argue that the charge will be unfair and ineffective.

### Excessive influence

The Peel Group has been accused of exerting excessive influence over local politics and planning decisions, particularly in the North West of England.

### Tax evasion

The company has been accused of tax evasion, with several investigations launched into its tax affairs.

### HMS Plymouth

The Peel Group's plans to develop a new museum on the site of the HMS Plymouth, a historic warship, have been met with opposition from local residents, who argue that the development will be insensitive and damaging to the area's heritage.

### Marine Terminals industrial action

The company's marine terminals business has been hit by industrial action, with several workers claiming that they have been unfairly treated.

### MV Francop

The Peel Group's MV Francop, a cargo ship, was involved in a major accident in 2019, which raised concerns over the company's safety record.

### Warrington traffic

The company's plans to develop a new logistics hub in Warrington have been met with opposition from local residents, who argue that the development will increase traffic congestion and air pollution.

### Land hoarding

Money in the Bank (2023)
==========================

Money in the Bank was a professional wrestling pay-per-view (PPV) event produced by WWE. It took place on July 1, 2023, at The O2 Arena in London, England. The event was the 14th annual Money in the Bank event and the first to be held in the United Kingdom.

Production
----------

### Background

Money in the Bank is a concept based on a ladder match, where multiple wrestlers compete to retrieve a briefcase suspended above the ring. The winner of the match earns a contract for a world championship match, which can be cashed in at any time within the next year. The event has been a staple of WWE's PPV calendar since 2010.

The 2023 event was announced in April, with tickets going on sale shortly thereafter. The event was heavily promoted, with a series of vignettes and promotional videos airing on WWE television.

### Storylines

The event was built around several key matches and storylines. In the main event, Seth Rollins faced Drew McIntyre for the Undisputed WWE Universal Championship. The two had been feuding for several weeks, with McIntyre emerging as a surprise challenger for Rollins' title.

In addition to the main event, several other matches were announced in the lead-up to the event. These included a Money in the Bank ladder match, a SmackDown Women's Championship match between Ronda Rousey and Raquel Rodriguez, and a Raw Tag Team Championship match between The Usos and The Judgment Day.

Event
-----

### Preliminary matches

The event began with a Money in the Bank ladder match, featuring seven competitors from the Raw and SmackDown brands. The match was won by Damian Priest, who retrieved the briefcase after a thrilling match.

Next up was the SmackDown Women's Championship match, which saw Ronda Rousey successfully defend her title against Raquel Rodriguez. The match was marked by a series of near-falls and reversals, with Rousey ultimately emerging victorious.

The Raw Tag Team Championship match followed, with The Usos successfully defending their titles against The Judgment Day. The match was a high-energy affair, with both teams trading near-falls and showing impressive teamwork.

### Main event

The main event saw Seth Rollins face Drew McIntyre for the Undisputed WWE Universal Championship. The match was a highly anticipated affair, with both men trading near-falls and showing incredible athleticism.

In the end, McIntyre emerged victorious, pinning Rollins after a Claymore Kick to win the title. The crowd erupted in cheers as McIntyre celebrated his title win, marking a major upset in the WWE universe.

Reception

The event received generally positive reviews from critics and fans alike. Many praised the high-energy matches and the surprise title win by McIntyre.

The event was also notable for its large attendance, with over 18,000 fans packing The O2 Arena in London. The event marked a major milestone for WWE, which has been expanding its global reach in recent years.

Aftermath

The show also saw the return of several injured superstars, including Randy Orton and Cody Rhodes. Both men made their presence known, with Orton attacking McIntyre and Rhodes confronting Rollins.

The show also saw the return of several injured superstars, including Sasha Banks and Naomi. Both women made their presence known, with Banks attacking Rousey and Naomi confronting Rodriguez.

article:
John Cruys
================

John Cruys was a 14th-century English nobleman and landowner who played a significant role in the history of Ireland during the medieval period. As a member of the Anglo-Norman aristocracy, Cruys held various titles and properties throughout Ireland, including the prestigious Merrion Castle. His life and career are a testament to the complex web of alliances, rivalries, and power struggles that characterized the medieval Irish nobility.

Background
----------

John Cruys was born into a prominent Anglo-Norman family that had settled in Ireland in the 12th century. His ancestors had arrived in Ireland as part of the Norman invasion of 1169, led by Earl Richard de Clare, also known as Strongbow. Over the centuries, the Cruys family had established themselves as a powerful and influential force in Irish society, with significant landholdings and titles.

Merrion Castle and other Cruys holdings
--------------------------------------

One of the most significant properties held by the Cruys family was Merrion Castle, located in what is now County Dublin. Merrion Castle was a strategically important fortress that controlled access to the city of Dublin and the surrounding countryside. The castle had been built by the Cruys family in the 13th century and had been the seat of their power and influence for generations.

In addition to Merrion Castle, the Cruys family held other significant properties throughout Ireland, including lands in County Kildare, County Meath, and County Louth. These properties were crucial to the family's wealth and influence, providing them with a significant source of income and power.

Career
--------

John Cruys began his career as a young nobleman, serving as a member of the retinue of the Lord Lieutenant of Ireland. He quickly proved himself to be a skilled and capable military leader, participating in several campaigns against the native Irish and rival Anglo-Norman families.

In the 1360s, Cruys was appointed as the Constable of Dublin Castle, a prestigious position that gave him control over the city and its defenses. He played a key role in the defense of the city against the native Irish and was instrumental in maintaining order and stability in the region.

The Verdon inheritance
----------------------

In the 1370s, Cruys inherited a significant portion of the Verdon estates, which included lands in County Louth and County Meath. The Verdon family had been prominent Anglo-Norman landowners in Ireland, and their estates were highly prized for their strategic location and economic value.

The inheritance of the Verdon estates significantly increased Cruys' wealth and influence, making him one of the most powerful nobles in Ireland. He used his newfound wealth and power to expand his holdings and consolidate his position as a leading member of the Anglo-Norman aristocracy.

Later career
-------------

In the 1380s, Cruys continued to play a significant role in Irish politics and society. He served as a member of the Irish Parliament and was involved in several high-profile disputes with rival noble families.

Despite his advanced age, Cruys remained a formidable figure in Irish society, respected for his military prowess and his unwavering commitment to the Anglo-Norman cause. He died in the early 1390s, leaving behind a legacy as one of the most influential and powerful nobles of his generation.

Family
--------

John Cruys was married to a member of the prominent Anglo-Norman family, the de Berminghams. His wife was a member of the family that had founded the monastery of Athenry in County Galway, and the couple had several children together.

Cruys' children went on to play significant roles in Irish society, with several of them becoming prominent nobles and landowners in their own right. His descendants continued to play a major role in Irish politics and society for centuries, with many of them serving as members of the Irish Parliament and holding high-ranking positions in the government and military.
